loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda P. is from the village of Panay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old. Imelda is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products like bread, drinks, and noodles in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Imelda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from GDMPC. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Imelda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Saren

texts.en:
Mrs. Saren S., 40, is a widow with four children: two sons and two daughters. She lives in a village along National Road Number One, about fifteen kilometer from Phnom Penh City.

Saren has been a scarf weaver for fifteen years. She is asking for her first loan of $600 to set up one more loom and to purchase sewing thread for her scarf-weaving business.

loans.use: To set up one more loom and to buy sewing thread for her scarf-weaving business

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson Y. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 42 years old. Samson is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Samson owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting mangoes for sale. Samson has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Samson joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Samson has successfully repaid a previous loan of 50,000 PHP from GDMPC. Samson is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 15th loan taken out by Samson from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en:
Tsetsegmaa B. is 45 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Hovd province, western Mongolia.

Tsetsegmaa operates a food retailing business. She began her business in 2000 which enabled her to purchase a yard on a plot of land where her family currently lives. Her husband works as a driver for a local road company and their elder child is a student, while the younger one attends a local middle school.

Since she has been managing a food retailing business, Tsetsegmaa has gained much experience and has increased her product line. She is the kind of person who is hardworking and modest.

Tsetsegmaa is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase a variety of dairy products at wholesale prices.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of dairy products to sell

loans.name: Creselda

texts.en:
Creselda R. is from the village of Luksoon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Creselda is married and has 2 very young children. To make a living, Creselda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Creselda has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Creselda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Creselda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Creselda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Creselda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Ms. Anita L. has been a member of ASHI since 2005 and has been faithful and active. She’s been in the business of food vending for a year now.

Ms. L. is 53 years old, married, and blessed with three children. Her eldest, Leonilo, 26 years old, is a high school graduate and works in a factory; the second, Maricris, is 23 years old and is also a high school graduate; and the youngest, Edward, 15, is a third-year student.

The family resides in El Dorado, Antipolo City, Rizal, Philippines, where Ms. L. put up her food-vending business. Because their place was proclaimed as a city, migrants from other municipalities transfer to the place to seek jobs. Because of this, it opens business opportunities, especially in food vending.

Ms. L. grabbed the opportunity and has applied for a loan of Php 17,000 payable in weekly installments, so that she can meet the demand of her increasing number of customers waiting for her delicious food. She is planning to buy more meat, vegetables, ingredients, soft drinks and cooking utensils to expand her business.

Ms. L. wanted to learn and cook new menus, too, for her customers to love. With help from ASHI and Kiva she is praying her plans will materialize. The accomplishment of her dreams is to expand her business, earn more, and send her children to college to pursue a career.

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables, ingredients and additional cooking utensils

loans.name: Borey

texts.en: Mrs. Borey B. lives in Samchat village in Takeo province and she is 34 years old. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice on to support her family, and she is also a clothes seller who sells a lot of clothes to earn a large profit to support her family. Since her clothes sales are going well, she wants to expand. So to improve her current business, Mrs. Borey B. is asking for a loan to buy more clothes to resell. She is a widow who does not have any children and she lives in a three-member household.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell

loans.name: Sokhum

texts.en:
Mr. Sokhum T., 40 (pictured with his wife), has been a construction worker for ten years. His wife, Mrs. Sina Nut, 28, has been a garment factory worker for three years. They have been married since 1998 and have two young children: one son and one daughter. They live in a village along National Road Number One, about fifteen kilometer from Phnom Penh City.

Sokhum is asking for his first loan of $900 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy M. is from the town of Segatic Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 34 years old. Juvy is single. To make a living, Juvy owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products like toothpaste, noodles, and soap in the local community. Juvy has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juvy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juvy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Juvy is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Juvy from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Keam

texts.en:
The smiling-faced person shown in the photo is Mrs. T., a 45-year-old village woman who has had a job as a rice farmer since she was single. In addition, she raises a few pigs from which she is able to generate extra revenue to meet the financial crisis of her family. She runs her business at home and earns approximately $5 a day. Her husband frequently works in the farm fields alongside her.

There is a neighboring farmland in good location for farming. T. wants to be the owner of this land but she doesn’t have enough money to buy it. Thus, she is looking for loan to be able to afford to purchase the farmland where she will plant more crops.

loans.use: To purchase neighboring farmland where she will plant crops

loans.name: Jean Marie

texts.en:
Jean Marie C. is from the village of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Jean Marie is single. To make a living, Jean Marie owns & operates a fish-selling business. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling fish like "tuloy", "pirit", "sigarilyo" to local community members. Jean Marie has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jean Marie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jean Marie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jean Marie is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Jean Marie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Sithavy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sithavy U., age 29, is a married woman and the village bank president who was selected by the nine members of this group loan. They are all located in Khop Leu village in the Kandal province. Each member of this village loan will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses.

Mrs. Sithavy U. is a tailor at home, while her husband, Mr. RattanA. P., is a teacher in the local school. With both of these occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. In order to increase their income to improve the family's lives, Mrs. Sithavy U. will use the loan to buy piglets for breeding and to buy pig food. This couple has two children. One is attending the local school while another, age 4, is not yet in school.

loans.use: To buy piglets for breeding and to buy pig food

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mr. Chantha L. is 42 years old and his wife, Mrs. Lam Thor, is 38 years old. They have been married for three years and have no children yet. The couple live in a small village along National Road Number Five about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Chantha has been a construction worker since he was single and his wife has been a garment factory worker for nine years. He hopes to change his business to a motor remoque taxi, so he is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike and trailer to launch the business.

A motor remoque is a motorcycle connected to a trailer at the back, and can carry many goods and people.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike and trailer

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sinat, shown in the photo with her loom, is 35 years old and her husband, Mr. Saveun Chheu, is 35 years old. They have been married since 1995 and have two young daughters. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
 
Sinat has been a silk weaver for fifteen years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a construction worker for ten years.

Sinat wants to supplement her income with another business: raising pigs. So she is asking for her first loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy piglets and pig feed. She will also use a part of the loan to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and pig feed plus silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanny N., who lives in Si Sla village in the Takeo province, is 54 years old. She is a farmer who owns a 3-hectare plot of land in which to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She is also a pig breeder, while her husband, Mr. Thorng Khiev, is a rice-wine maker and also owns a mill in the local village. 

Her problem is that in her field, it is time to grow rice but she does not have enough rice seed to support it. So to improve her production, Mrs. Vanny N. is asking for a loan to buy rice seed and with rest of the loan, she will buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline. 

She is the mother of three children, two of whom are attending school, while the other is a seamstress in a garment factory. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seed

loans.name: Baatar

texts.en: Baatar D. is a 40 year old retired man and he is engaged in running a small, successful business . He lives with his wife in Huvsgul province,  in western Mongolia.  He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent.  He has been  making wooden items since the age of 17. But in 2005, Baatar began his carpentry business in cooperation with a local construction company making wooden furniture while his wife started sewing clothing in their home town. Baatar is a very hard working, productive and initiative person. Baatar wants to create his own workplace in his town and enlarge his carpentry operation as well as developing his wife's sewing business and provide her with necessary materials and supplies. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to purchase more wood and timber for his business and supplies for his wife's sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase more wood and timber

loans.name: Soben

texts.en:
Mr. Soben S. (pictured here), and his wife, Mrs. Srun Chen, live in a small village along National Road Number three about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2005 and have two children: one son and one daughter. All of the children are still young. 
 
Soben is a driver. His wife stays at home She wants ot run a business-selling recycling materials but she does not have the start-up capital. Soben is asking for his second loan of $300 to provide his wife’s capital.

loans.use: To provide his wife’s capital to buy recycling materials for resale.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en: Leonila A. is from the city of Zamora, Ozamiz City. She is 45 years old. Leonila is separated from her spouse and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Leonila operates a transportation service. The main source of income for the business comes from operating "habal-habal" motor transport services. Leonila has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Leonila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Leonila is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the second loan taken out by Leonila from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna So (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. Thy Chann, have been were married in 1990 and have three children; one son and two daughters. The son and one of her daughters are garment factory workers and another daughter attends school. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, about 25 kilometers from the capital. 

Vanna has been selling roasted corn for more than five months. Her husband has been a mason since 1999. She has asked for a Kiva loan one time before to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to get work. Now her son is a garment factory worker, so she is applying for her second loan of 1,000 USD to buy a motorbike for her son to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her son to drive to work.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita J. is from the village of Libertad, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old, married and has 3 adult-aged children. Teresita owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste , biscuits, candies, milo (a malted chocolate beverage powder) and bread in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Teresita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Reyhum

texts.en:
Reyhum D. is from the village of Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. He is 26 years old and single. Reyhum owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, candies, noodles, canned goods and bread in the local community. Reyhum has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Reyhum joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reyhum is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Reyhum from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hong

texts.en:
Mr. Hong M. ( in the photo with his wife and daughter), is 45 years old and his wife Mrs. Yoeun Chhaum, is 43 years old. They have been married since 1994 and have two young daughters. All of them are in school. The family lives in a small village across Mekong River about 17 Kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Hong is a horse cart driver and fisherman. His wife has full-time employment.  He is asking for a loan in the amount of 250USD to purchase cows to raise.

loans.use: To purchase cow to raise.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en: Batbayar A. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His elder son is a student while the youngest two children attend a district middle school. Batbayar operates a photographic and copying service in the city with the help of his wife. The two are also earn income from their rental service. His working capital exceeds 5 million MNT and currently his daily earnings are from 30,000  to  40,000 MNT. He is planning on expanding his business in the future by growing his working capital. He is working to afford his children's future education. Batbayar is a modest person and is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to install additional heating in his home where the family is currently living and to increase his working capital.

loans.use: To install additional heating in his home

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
C. lives in the province of Kompong Tom, which is the best territory for farming. C. is a married mother who is devoted to her two young children. Both of them are students in the secondary school.  

C. owns a big farm that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows various crops on it. She also relies on the income from her husband, who works fishing in and around the river. C. will be using a loan she requested to facilitate her farm work for buying fertilizer, insecticide, and crop seed to grow.

loans.use: To facilitate her  farm work with fertilizer, insecticide, and crop seed to grow.

loans.name: Socheat

texts.en:
Mrs. Socheat C. (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. Vantha Vong, have been married since 1996 and have two children who attend school. The family lives along National Road No. 1, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Socheat has been a garment factory worker for more than nine years, while Mr. Vantha Vong has been a vegetable farmer for more than fifteen years. Socheat is requesting her second loan in the amount of US$ 700 to use as business capital to purchase fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his vegetable farm. He will be able to continue increasing his productivity.

loans.use: purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide for her husband's vegetable farm

loans.name: Thach

texts.en:
Mrs. Thach H. (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. Thach Try, live along National Road Number One about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married for more than twenty-five years and have six children: two sons and four daughters. 

Thach has been selling vegetables for more than ten years. Her husband has been a mason for more than twelve years. She hopes to continue expanding her business, so she is asking for a loan in the amount of 1,200 USD to purchase additional vegetables for resale.

loans.use: To continue expanding her business

loans.name: Severino

texts.en:
Severino T. is from the village of Catarman, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. He is 31 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Severino owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting fruits such as mango and "lanzones" for sale. Severino has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Severino joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Severino is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Severino from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom S. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Bunthol Teang, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They married in 1975 and have 5 children--2 sons and 3 daughters. Two of them weave silk at home, one is a security guard, one is a goldsmith, and another one studies at a local school. 

Mom has been a silk weaver for more than twenty years. Her husband has been a policeman for more than thirty years. She is requesting a loan of US$ 300 to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Meriecris

texts.en:
Meriecris T. is from the village of Bunawan Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Meriecris is married and has two school-age children.  Meriecris owns a specialized retail store selling mobile phone credit loads, can goods, noodles, eggs, candies, and shampoo in the local community. Meriecris has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 14,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Meriecris joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Meriecris has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase new equipment and tools to expand the business. Meriecris is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in further expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Meriecris from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Sokhun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhun C. (in the picture) is 48. She and her husband, Mr. Thy Em, 43, live a suburb of Phnom Penh. They have been married for 20 years and have one daughter who is also married. Their son-in-law and grandchild are living with them. 

Sokhun is a rice farmer. Her husband is a construction worker. The family does not have their own transportation so traveling costs them a lot of money. She is requesting her first loan of US$ 700 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita M. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 69 years old. Lolita is married and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Lolita owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked foods "bihon," "pancit," and "sari-sari" for daily meals. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Lolita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Sam-Ang

texts.en:
Mr. Sam-ang K., 28, (pictured with his wife) and his wife, Mrs. Channy Em, 32, live in a village along National Road Number Two about 12 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2000 and have two sons. One of them attends school and other one is still  too young.  

Sam-ang is a driver. His wife is a garment factory worker. Besides driving, he also operates a business producing pots and vases for sale. He is requesting his first loan of US$ 1,000 to expand his business. He will use a part of the loan to repair his kitchen.

loans.use: To repair kitchen and expand his business

loans.name: Randy

texts.en:
Randy M. is from the village of Agunod Plaridel Misamis Occidental. He is 38 years old. Randy is married and has three school-age children. To make a living, Randy owns a specialized retail store which sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, and bread in the local community. Randy has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Randy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Randy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. Randy is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Oyunbolor

texts.en:
Oyunbolor M. is 22 years old and lives with her mother and younger sister in Govi-Altay province, western Mongolia.  She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. She currently operates a small food retailing business in her town while her mother sews traditional costumes at her home. 

Oyunbolor started her food retailing in 2009 to earn a living for her family. After building a stable operation, Oyunbolor used some of her earnings to expand her business which enabled her to create a bigger customer base in the town. She attributes her success to her ability to deliver quality products to the consumer. 

Oyunbolor hopes to continue to grow her business in the future and is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase more supplies and products to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies and products

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanny P., 50, (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. Thina Leng, 52, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1981 and have six children--five sons and one daughter. 

Vanny is a silk weaver. Her husband is a carpenter. She is applying for a loan of US$ 1,000 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Kuy

texts.en:
Kuy T., aged 47, owns and operates a farming business. Her main activity is cultivating crops on her own plot of farmland from which she earns a living. 

Kuy T. has a life partner in her husband who works on the farm field with her. This couple is married with nine children, six of whom have got married. The remaining three are single. Kuy T. planted rice crops two months ago but they are not growing well due to a lack of fertilizer. To solve the problem, Kuy T. asked for a loan to buy sacks of fertilizer to improve her crop yield.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer to improve her crop yield

loans.name: Saophorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Saophorn Y. was born in 1981 and is a villager in Mea Neak village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Bul Saut, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice which helps support the family.  

Additionally, they are duck breeders who can earn some money from selling eggs. Since her husband’s duck breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it. To improve this business, Mrs. Saophorn Y. is asking for a loan to buy two hundred ducks. 

She is a mother of three children, two of whom are attending school, while the youngest one is two years old. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy two hundred ducks

loans.name: Schhunna's Group

texts.en:
Five people make up this group loan, which located in Preak Raing village, Kandal province. Mrs. Chhunna C., 32, is the leader of this group loan having been selected by its five members. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses.     

Mrs. Chhunna C. is a grocery seller in the local village while her husband, Mr. Kea Soeng, is a teacher in the local school. With both of these occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. Since the grocery business is going well, Mrs. Chhunna C. will use the loan from AMK to buy more groceries to sell. 

This couple has two children, one is attending the local school and the youngest one is three years old and not in school yet.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Oyunchimeg

texts.en:
From Huvsgul Province in western Mongolia, Oyunchimeg H. is a 41-year old widow who lives with her three children, all students, in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Although suffering from heart disease, Oyunchimeg has been operating a small food stand in her town since 2000, and her business methods and experience have improved steadily, as have her sales numbers. Known as a reliable borrower from XacBank, she has thus far received and repaid 17 loan. Initially she began this business with working capital of 300,000 MNT, but now it has reached 2,000,000 MNT.

Oyunchimeg is a hardworking and modest woman who would like to keep growing her business. She says, “ I want to be able to afford my children's university tuition fees so that they can help me after graduation.” She is requesting a 2,000,000MNT loan in order to purchase a large amount of food for her stand and to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of food for her stand

loans.name: Samen

texts.en:
Mr. Samen S. was born in 1974 and lives in Samchat village in Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Saroum Prak, are farmers who own a one-hectare plot of land on which they cultivate rice to support their family. Additionally, he is a construction worker.

His problem is that his field has infertile soil and has a lot of insects. To improve his production of rice, Mr. Samen S. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide. He is a father of three children, two of whom are attending school, while the youngest one is three years old. His wife is in the picture with him.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Then

texts.en: Then T. N. was born in 1981. She is married with two children (a son and a daughter). She has a shoe shop in the market. Her husband is a businessman. They have a monthly income of about 5,000,000 VND. She has participated in SEDA since 2006 and has repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to expand her shoe shop.

loans.use: to expand her shoe shop

loans.name: Em

texts.en: Mrs. Em N., 63, lives in Kouk Roka village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Chhorm Chhay, are farmers who own a four-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Their field's soil is infertile and has a lot of insects. To improve rice production, Mrs. Em N. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and gasoline. She is the mother of two children who are seamstresses in a garment factory. Her husband appears in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides and gasoline

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Parveen Akhtar is 44 years old and married with two daughters. She resides in a city called Multan, famous in Pakistan for its sweetmeats and shrines. 

A very talented and caring lady, Parveen owns and operates a boutique business on a small scale. She is also a very good mother and carries out her responsibilities as a housewife well. Her elder daughter is fourteen years old and the second one is just one year younger. Both stay at home and help their mother in taking care of domestic chores. Her husband, M. A., works in a factory on a monthly wage. 

Parveen displays her hand-made embroidered clothes in her boutique. She uses a room of her house for her boutique business. She has been doing this work for over fifteen years. She has a good clientele. She imports clothes from different cities such as Faisalabad and Lahore, famous for their textiles and new designs, and then makes them more beautiful by crafting new embroidered designs on them. She earns approximately 5,000 PKRs every month but it is double that amount on occasion. 

Parveen has applied for a loan from Asasah for her boutique business. With the loan amount she will buy clothes, beads, tassels and sketches in large quantity and make more dresses to display in her boutique. She is hopeful that this investment will help her to make more dresses because the Eid (Muslim festival which comes after Ramadan) is near and people will come to her to buy beautiful clothes.  

Parveen is in her 4th loan and has shown herself to be a responsible loan user in Asasah. In the previous years of loan experience she has maintained a good credit record and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: Purchase materials for boutique business

loans.name: Saveoun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Savoeun N., 49, is the president selected by the nine members of this village group loan, located in Samraong Káe village in Kandal province. The members of this group will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Savoeun N. breeds fish at home while her husband, Mr. K. Khoem, is a fisherman. With these occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. In order to support her husband's fishing business, Mrs. Savoeun N. has requested a loan from AMK to buy fishnets. This couple has five children: one is a seamstress in a a garment factory and the other four are students who also help out with their parents' businesses.

loans.use: To buy fishnets

loans.name: Roun

texts.en:
Roun Y. is 47 years of age and a resident of Kompong Tom Province, where she earns a living as a local cultivator. To have extra proceeds, Roun Y. makes cakes to sell to nearby villagers. She has another financial earner in her husband who owns instruments to use to provide music for a profit. The couple are the good parents of nine children. Four of them are now married and live independently, while other five are single.

In the past, Roun Y. hired a neighbor’s pump to irrigate her crops because she didn’t have her own pump. She now hopes to buy one by using a Kiva loan.

loans.use: To buy a pump to irrigate her crops

loans.name: Neng

texts.en: Mrs. Neng M. was born in 1945 and lives in Prey Kabbas Kha village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Meou Tieng, are farmers who own a 1.5-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Her husband is also a laborer. Although they work a lot, they earn very little money to support their family. To improve this situation, Mrs. Neng M. is requesting a loan to start a new business and buy a cow for breeding. She will use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and gasoline. She is the mother of a child who is a teacher. Her husband appears in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people and is located in K’am Samnor Leu village, Kandal province. Mrs. Chantha S., a 25-year-old married woman, has been selected as group leader of the loan by its members. All members of this group will use their portions of the loan to support their different businesses.

Mrs. Chantha S. and her husband, Mr. Chork Mom, are farmers who own a 1-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice and vegetables for a living. Mrs. Chantha S. has requested a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for farming laborers to cultivate rice and vegetables. This couple works very hard on the farm to support their family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay for farming laborers to cultivate rice and vegetables

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
In Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province lives Mrs. Leng K. who was born in 1963. She and her husband, Mr. Sambath K., are farmers who own a three-hectare (7.5-acre) plot of land that they use to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Moreover, Mrs. Leng K. is also a Khmer cake seller while her husband is also a duck breeder who is able to earn some money from selling eggs.

Mrs. Leng K.’s problem is that her field has infertile soil and it has a lot of insects. So, to improve her production of rice, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to rent plowing machine to plow her field. With the rest of the loan, she plans to buy more ducks and duck feed.

Mrs. Leng K. is the mother of a child who is studying in school. Her husband is shown with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide, to rent a plowing machine to plow her field, and to buy more ducks and duck feed

loans.name: Lua

texts.en:
Lua T. N. was born in 1985 and is married with two children who are still young. Her husband is a carpenter.

Not only does Lua T. N. grow rice but she also sells clothes in the market and the couple has a monthly income of about 5,000,000 VND. She has always needed loans to invest her shop so, since 2004, she has participated in SEDA and repaid punctually.

For this loan, Lua T. N. would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to expand her clothes shop.

loans.use: To expand her clothes shop

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is the wife of M. A. and resides in a city called Multan, famous in Pakistan for its sweetmeats and shrines. She owns a small house of two rooms there and has been living in it with her family for over fifteen years.  

Shamim has given birth to six children: four daughters and two sons. All of her children are enrolled in a local school and read in different grades: 9th, 4th and 2nd respectively. She is bringing them up with care and discipline and wants to provide them with a quality education so they make their future bright. To achieve this purpose she works hard at running a boutique business in her house. 

She uses a room of her house for her boutique where she displays embroidered and non-embroidered dresses and attracts customers. People who approach her mostly are her neighbors. She imports cloth from Faisalabad and Lahore, famous for their textiles, and then sews them well and makes embroidery on them to give them a new look to attract more customers. She earns approximately 10,000 PKRs from her business. Her income becomes double on special occasions. Eid, the Muslim holiday which comes after Ramadan, is near and she can improve her sales on this occasion. That’s why she has applied for a loan from Asasah for this purpose.

With the loan amount she will buy cloth, colored thread and beads in large quantity which will help her to make more dresses to display in her boutique. She is in her 2nd loan and has shown herself to be a very responsible loan user of Asasah.

loans.use: Purchase required items for boutique business

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.en:
Leoncio D. is from the village of Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. He is 54 years old and is married with two school-aged children. Leoncio owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, oil, Nescafe, Maggi Magic Sarap (all-in-one seasoning granules) and posporo (matches) in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Leoncio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Leoncio is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his second from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
To earn a living, 45-year-old Mrs. Oun S. owns a location outside of her home where she distills white wine to sell. Oun S. also uses any leftovers from distilling to raise a few pigs to generate additional income. Besides this, she and her husband always take time to plant a rice crop during the rainy season.

Their pigpen frequently breaks down, so Oun S. proposes to repair it but she lacks money. Therefore, she has decided to seek a loan in order to mend her old stall. If there is enough money from the loan, Oun S. will build a bigger stall for her pigs.

loans.use: To mend her old pigpen

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan T. V. was born in 1977 and is married with two children who are going to school. Her husband is a carpenter and she sells shoes in the market where she has a shoe shop.

Since 2007, Loan T. V. has participated in SEDA and repaid punctually. For this loan, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to expand her shop.

loans.use: To expand her shoe shop

loans.name: Sa Vang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sa Vang E., 53, was selected as the leader of this group loan by its four members, who are located in Khpob Veng village in Kandal province. The members of this group will use their portiO. of the loan to support their different purposes.   

Mrs. Sa Vang E. is a grocery seller and also a vegetable seller in the local market. With this business, she is able to earn a small income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Mok Yong, stays at home and takes care their children. In order to support her grocery business, Mrs. Sa Vang E. will use the loan requested from AMK to buy more groceries to sell. This couple has five children; three are seamstresses in the garment factory and one is a wedding chef, while the other is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace E. is from the village of Tipolo Plaridel Occidental. She is 47 years old. Grace is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Grace owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, candies, eggs, energy drinks, and fruits, like lanzones, in the local community. Grace has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Grace joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and engage in business activities. Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and build up working capital. Grace is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Grace from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units of offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tuong

texts.en: Tuong T. T. was born in 1981. She lives in Xom Trong village, Uy No commune. She is married with two children who are still young. Mrs Tuong sells clothes in the market and her husband is a worker. They have a monthly income of about 5,000,000 VND. She needs a loan to invest in her shop. She has borrowed through SEDA since 2007 and always repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to expand her clothes shop.

loans.use: To expand her clothes shop

loans.name: Nak's Group

texts.en:
This group loan has four members and have selected Mrs. Nak N. as their group leader.  She was born in 1955 and lives in Prey Lvea Lech village in Takeo province. Each member will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their businesses. 

Mrs. Nak N. is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land where she grows rice to support her family.  Additionally, she is a weaver. Her problem is that her field is ready to harvest but she does not have money to support it. So to improve this situation, Mrs. Nak N. is applying for a loan to hire farming laborers to harvest her rice and with the rest of the loan she will rent a plowing machine. 

She is a widow with seven children, three of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory, one is helping her to do the farming, and the others are studying in school.

loans.use: To hire farming laborers to harvest her rice

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
Som P., 57, works with her husband to hire out tables, chairs and other wedding equipment to the local people in Kampong Cham province. She is married with one child, who is employed as a worker. 

Som P. and her husband, who is pictured here, earn the most during ceremony season (November to April). She typically makes about US$ 4 each day, and would like a loan to expand her business. In order to increase her profits, she is asking for US$ 1000 to purchase more chairs and tables.

loans.use: To purchase more chairs and tables to rent out

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Lien T. N. was born in 1975. She lives with her son in Xom Trong village, Uy No commune. She sells Che in the market (it is a drink made from beans). She raises her son alone. So she has to work hard. She has participated in SEDA since 2006 and always repaid punctually. This time she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to expand her store.

loans.use: To expand her store

loans.name: Chanlea's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanlea C., 42, is the leader of this group loan, selected by its four members, who all live in Chrolong village in Kandal province. Each member of this group will use their portion of the loan to support their different businesses.
Mrs. Chanlea C. and her husband, Mr. Phoem Pich, are farmers who own 1-hectare of land to cultivate rice for a living. Besides farming, Mrs. Chanlea C. is also a Khmer noodle seller in the local market. With both occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family.  
Mrs. Chanlea C. is now requesting for a loan to buy soil to fill her front yard. This couple has seven children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory and one is a construction worker while the other five are students in the local school and also help their parents on the farm.

loans.use: To buy soil to fill her front yard

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy T. T. H. was born in 1971. She has two children who go to school. She has a store in the market and has a monthly income of about 4,000,000 VND. She wants to earn more money to raise her children. 

Thuy has participated in SEDA since 2006. She borrowed a loan and repaid it punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8.502.000 VND to invest in her store.

loans.use: to invest in her store

loans.name: Chem

texts.en: Chem Y. is 42 years old and sells motorcycles in Takeo province. He is a motorcycle dealer but he often purchases an old motorbike and repairs it before he sells it. His business has been around for about ten years and he makes US$ 5 every day. He is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to purchase an old motorbike and resell it for a profit. He sees this investment as an opportunity that will increase his daily income.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for resale

loans.name: Harm

texts.en:
To earn a good living for her family, Harm B. started a job selling cakes from her home. Normally, she goes to the market where she buys essential ingredients, mixes them together, and fries them in oil to sell to her nearby neighbors. 

Harm B. is a single mother who has given birth to three children, all three of whom are employed at different occupations. Harm B. dreams of having a place to distill wine for additional revenue, but her dreams have not come true because of lack of funds. To achieve her goal, Harm B. has requested a loan in order to build a wine-distilling set-up.

loans.use: To build a wine-distilling set-up

loans.name: Salma's Group

texts.en:
Salma is the wife of M. N. and resides in a city called Multan, famous in Pakistan for its sweetmeats and shrines.  She is 22 years old and has one son. She got her education up to 5th standard but couldn’t get further education due to poor financial conditions in her family. She mostly spent time with her mother and learnt the skill of embroidery from her.

Her mother worked at a boutique business. Salma got the experience of running a boutique from her and now, by the grace of God, she has started doing the same business after her marriage. Now she makes dresses to display in her boutique and attract customers.  

Her son is just one year old; his name is Ghulam Jailani. She wants a good future for him, and that’s why she works hard to fulfill that dream. Her husband is a tailor by trade. He runs a tailoring shop in the nearby market where he sews specifically men's clothes and earns income.  

Salma has applied for a loan from Asasah for her boutique business. With the loan amount she will buy cloth, colored thread, and sketches in large quantity and make more dresses to display in her boutique.  She is on her 2nd loan. In her first year of loan experience she has paid her installments on time and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: Purchase embroidering materials to make dresses for sale

loans.name: Vy

texts.en:
Vy T. N. was born in 1958. She has a son, who works for a company near the house. Vy sells clothes in the market. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND.

She has participated in SEDA since 2007 and repaid punctually. She wants to expand her clothes shop, so she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND.

loans.use: to expand her clothes shop

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana P. is from the village of Libertad, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 53 years old. Juana is married and has one adult children. To make a living, Juana owns & operates a business buying and selling bananas in the local community. Juana has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Juana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Juana is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Juana from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mrs. Ith Aen Village Bank Group

texts.en: Eight people who live in Roleang Kreul village in Takeo province make up a village bank loan. Mrs. Ith A. is the village bank president who was born in 1955. She was selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan in various ways to support their businesses in the current year. She and her husband, Mr. Nhoem Sok, are farmers who own a half-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. She is also a vegetable seller and her husband is a taxi driver. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. So Mrs. Ith A. is applying for a loan to buy more vegetables to sell. She is a mother of a child who is attending school.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Digno Franklin

texts.es:
Digno de 40 años, vive en una zona perirubana en el Paraiso de Guayaquil, el tiene una panaderia en la parte delantera de su casa. Por la inseguridad que hay en el sector por donde vive opto por poner rejas en todo el local de la panaderia.

Inicio con la panaderia por la falta de oportunidades, para poder mantener a su esposa y tres hijas, comenzo con una vitrina y un viejo horno, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo readecuar su casa para ubicar una panaderia y vender tambien vivieres, en ocaciones hace carreras como chofer en su carro para tener mas ingresos y asegurar la vida economica de su familia.
 
Para poder continuar con su negocio el quiere comprar harina y huevos ya que el estar mucho tiempo de pie le causa dolor de piernas, en el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y surtir mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Digno is 40 years old. He lives in a semi-urban zone in Paraiso de Guayaquil. He has a bakery in the back part of his house. Because of the lack of safety in the area where he lives, Digno put bars around his house and bakery. Digno opened his bakery because of the lacking opportunities to support his wife and three daughters. He began with a glass case and an old oven, and little by little and with a lot of effort, he was able to put a bakery into his house. He also has a general store. On occasion, he works as a chauffeur so he can make more money and ensure his family's financial security. To be able to continue his business, Digno wants to buy flour and eggs since spending a lot of time on his feet causes pain in his legs. In the future he wants to be able to construct a house and improve his business.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying flour and eggs

loans.name: Ching

texts.en:
Ching M. is from the village of Camanga, Tukuran Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 65 years old. Ching is married. To make a living, Ching owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. Ching has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ching joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ching has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Ching is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Ching from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 36 years old, married and a mother of six children who are all attending school. She has been practising mixed farming for 18 years in the town of Kisii, Western Kenya. Her farm produces maize, beans, millet, vegetables, tomatoes, sugarcane, tea leaves and milk, all of which are sold at the local market, to Kenya Tea Development Authority, and to other retailers.

Jane has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 80,000 Kenyan Shillings to open a cereal business dealing  mainly with millet. The profits from this loan will go towards the education of her children and she will be able to feed her family well.

In five years' time, she plans to lease more land and plant sugarcane which is her main source of income and also expand her cereal store.

Her biggest challenges have been unpredictable weather patterns that affect vegetables especially during dry spells, high cost of farm inputs, and transportation problems.  She is grateful to Juhudi for teaching her business skills that have enabled her to plan her life well and even  educate her children.

loans.use: To open a cereal business

Sem R. is a 59-year-old rice grower and local farmer from Kompong Tom Province. She runs her business on her own farmland, where she raises rice crops and pigs. She will sell them to a buyer when they have matured. Her husband helps her with the farm work. 

Sem R. has ten children, two of whom are already married; the others are single. To help support the family, six of her children are employed at various jobs. Sem R. also has an unemployed son who needs to get a suitable job, but he doesn’t have capital to invest in one. Thus, Sem R. is applying for a loan to be used to buy a new motorcycle for her son to use to provide a mototaxi service.

loans.name: Kaniz Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Kaniz Fatima has applied for a loan from Asasah for her clothes-selling business. She is 55 years old and is married with two sons. She lives in a city called Multan, in Pakistan, that is famous for its sweetmeats and shrines. She owns a small house of two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over thirty years.

Kaniz’s elder son is a welder, welding items on order. He has received an education up to 8th standard but couldn’t study further and had to start doing work because his family needs his financial support. Now he is working hard to provide the best education facilities for his younger brother. His parents feel good to see him having such care for his family and especially for his brother.

Kaniz herself is also a very hardworking lady. She owns and operates a business selling clothes that she imports from Faisalabad (famous for its textile industry) and sells in her nearby market and in the community as well. She earns approximately 4,000 PKR from her business every month. She does this work to share the financial burden with her son.

Kaniz is hopeful that this loan will bring positive change in her business and that she can earn a good profit from it. This is the first time that she has applied for a loan from any microfinance institution and she wants to build a longterm relationship with Asasah.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Sulton

texts.en: The agriculture business is one that requires much effort for the simple reasons that it requires sun exposure, the physical exertion of moving animals from one place to another, as well as the work it takes to tend to various crops. Sulton, has dedicated himself for already ten years to cattle raising which supports his humble family who so rely on him. Currently, Sulton has turned to IMON International for a loan of 5,600 Somoni to purchase calves that he can raise. It’s important to note that the granting of this loan will not only benefit him, but also his children and wife whom he loves greatly. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase calves to raise and sell

loans.name: Shairkul's Group

texts.en: The first half of 2010 was marked by significant changes in the political sphere of the Kyrgyz Republic. More particularly, there was the revolution that happened on the 7th of April and interethnic conflict in the southern part of the Kyrgyz Republic. These events changed the situation in the Kyrgyz Republic in all of its aspects: social, economic, political, etc. While the government is working towards stabilizing the situation, ordinary people are trying to return to their normal way of life. So are Shairkul D., the leader of this group, and all the members of her group. Shairkul is married and has four children. She works as a cook in the hospital and earns 1,400 soms monthly. She and her husband are representative of traditional Kyrgyz families: they live together with her husband’s parents and breed cattle. They are almost fifteen years into their cattle breeding business. They started their business with an initial investment of 15,000 soms and it now brings 11,500 soms monthly. Now, they have bought a car for her husband and he is working as a taxi driver with an income of 10,000 soms. Shairkul and her husband realize the crucial role of education and want to give to their elder daughter an opportunity to study at an institution of higher education. Thus, they are asking for a loan of which the most part will go for the payment of the tuition fee for their daughter’s education and the another part will go to the purchase of hay for their cattle in order to continue their cattle breeding business. The other group members: Kului S. is the treasurer of the group. She is 49 and married with two sons: her elder son lives independently; her second son is 16 and is going to graduate from school this year. Kului works as a cook in the hospital and receives 1,800 soms monthly. Her husband is mainly involved in their family cattle-breeding business but also makes some money as a builder. They started their family cattle breeding business nine years ago with an initial investment of 5,000 soms. Now, they have significantly increased their livestock population and their business brings them 7,800 soms monthly. Together they have built a house for their elder son and he lives there with his wife. Now, their daughter is planning to get married. With the loan, Kului is planning to buy a dowry for her daughter. Azamat S. is 27 years old and is single. He works as a masseur in the hospital and receives 2,000 soms monthly. He bought an area of 0.7 hectares (1.75 acres) under crops. He started his business seven years ago with an initial investment of 10,000 soms and it now brings 5,100 soms monthly. Azamat wants to have a beloved wife and many children. Still, before getting married, he wants to build a house where he will live his happy married life with his family. He is asking for a loan which will help him to buy construction materials to build a house and his future. Nurzat A. is 40 and married. She is a nurse at the central hospital and receives 3,200 soms monthly. She has two daughters: her elder daughter is 16 and is going to graduate this year and her youngest daughter is 13 and goes to school. Nurzat’s husband is a farmer and their family business gives them 11,000 soms monthly. As with other mothers, she wants to give the best to her daughters. Thus, she is applying for a loan in order to pay the tuition fee of the institution of higher education so that her daughter has an opportunity to study and become a qualified specialist in the future. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To pay her daughter's tuition fee and to purchase hay for her cattle

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: I. Hasan is 46 years old and is married with six children. His wife is a housekeeper and Hasan’s business is their main source of income. Hasan has provided transportation services for the last eleven years. He dreams that all of his children will be well-educated and so he is working hard towards that. As a result the business generates a significant income, allowing him to support his large family. Currently Hasan needs to purchase spare parts for repairing his lorry (truck). He believes that this will make his business more profitable. With this purpose in mind, he requests 1,000 USD. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. loans.name: Azeezan

texts.en:
Azeezan lives in a small city called Raiwind, located in the Punjab province of Pakistan. She lives in a three-room brick house in the area of Ghouspura where she moved with her family nine years ago. She is 44 years of age and the mother of six children. Her elder sons have left their education and are currently working. One is an employee in the factory and other works in a church. Her younger children are attending school and getting their education.

Azeezan’s husband works in the factory and, after his day job, he operates a grocery shop in the market. Azeezan stays at home and takes care of her family and her cattle (cows and buffalos). She gets milk from her cattle and sells it in her community to support her family financially. She has been doing this work for the past three years.

The members of Azeezan’s family respect her for her supportive nature. She has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband who wants to buy groceries for his grocery shop. She is hopeful that this investment will help her husband to improve his business to a satisfactory level.

Azeezan is a regular loan user of Asasah and is on her 3rd loan. In her previous years of loan experience she has proved herself to be a responsible client who never missed a single meeting and paid her installments on time.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for her husband's grocery store

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en:
