They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is a member and the treasurer of the Orogare Bogetorora Group, which is being funded by Juhudi Kilimo. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 18 years and has employed six farmhands. Her farm produces maize, beans, milk, tea leaves and millet, which she sells to both the Kenya Tea Development Authority and the local market.

Norah has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to expand her cereals business. The proceeds from this loan will help her feed her family and educate her children. She faces the challenges of fluctuating prices and transportation problems.

Norah is 47 years old. She is married with six children who are between the ages of 10 and 26. Three of the children attend school.

In the future, she would like to expand her cereals business and venture into outside markets and also open a retail shop at her home area.

loans.use: To expand her cereals business

loans.name: Jean

texts.fr: Muhayimana Jean est un homme de 30  ans qui a été à Kigali, il vit actuellement en province de Kigali  district de Kicukiro, capital du Rwanda. Il est marié, il a trois enfants dont le plus âgée a 10 ans et le moins âgée a  1.5 ans trois vont à l’école. Il est habite à Gatenga district de Kicukiro, province ville de Kigali. Avec le prêt il veut acheter les haricots  , riz, savons, sucres pour les détailler en boutique, la clientèle des ces articles est  important car il a implanté sa boutique dans un quartier  de Karambo qui est énormément peuplé. Les mouvements des clients   lui permettent de vider très rapidement le stock et avoir la nécessité d’acheter beaucoup d’autres articles. Les épargnes continuelles lui permet de la survie de sa famille et il acheter une maison d’habitation, dans l’avenir il veut acheter une voiture, et planifier pour le bon futur de  sa famille.
texts.en:
Muhayimana Jean is a 30-year-old man who has been to Kigali.  He currently lives in Kigali province, Kicukiro district, in the capital of Rwanda.  He is married and has three children, the oldest of whom is 10 years old, and the youngest is 1½.  The three children go to school.  Jean was born in Gatenga, Kicukiro district, in Kigali province.  With this loan, Jean wants to buy beans, rice, soap, and sugar in order to sell them retail in his shop.  The customer base for these items is significant because he has set up his shop in a district in Karambo that is heavily populated.  The customer traffic enables him to empty his inventory very quickly, and this requires him to buy many more goods.  The continuous savings allow his family to survive and for him to buy a house.  For the future, he wants to buy a car and to plan the right future for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying beans, sugar, cornmeal, and rice to sell in his shop

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 57 years old. She is a married mother of two children who are ages 17 and 39. Her youngest child is currently attending school.

Rose is a farmer from the town of Nkubu in eastern Kenya. She has been managing her farm for the last 30 years and on several occasions has employed two or three casual employees. Her main products are coffee, which she sells to the coffee factory; cabbages; milk; carrots, which she sells to middlemen; and fine beans, which she sells to the Homegrown Company.

Her primary challenges have been pests and diseases, the high cost of farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticides, and a lack of enough capital for expansion.

Rose has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo of 41,600 Kenyan Shillings to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that this loan will enable her to acquire another dairy cow, which will increase her income and improve the living standards of her family. In the future, she plans to expand her dairy farming by acquiring four more dairy cows and a bigger and better zero-grazing shed. She also plans to expand her coffee farming.

She is grateful for the assistance offered by Juhudi and hopes to get another loan once she clears this loan.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Agagul

texts.en: Agagul A. is 40 years old. Ten years ago, he started a business selling cell phones and phone accessorizes. Agagul believes that this business is profitable and the income he generates allows him to support his family.  His monthly income is about 300-400 AZN. The product he sells is in very high demand among local people and Agagul is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN to purchase more phones and accessorize to increase his profit. This is his second loan and he promise to repay it in a timely manner like the first one, which he successfully completed.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Fabian

texts.en:
Fabian has been operating his mixed farm in Nkubu town, Eastern Kenya for the last 10 years. He has employed three people on a temporary basis. His main products are bananas, which he sells to middlemen, and fine beans, which he sells to Homegrown Company. He also runs a small snack and tea kiosk.

His primary challenges in farming have been insufficient water supply during the dry season, fluctuating banana prices during the rainy season and the high cost of fertilizer. Fabian has requested this loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings from Juhudi Kilimo in order to upgrade his banana farming. He says this loan will enable him to buy fertilizer which will help boost his production. The income from this loan will go towards the education of his children and will improve the family's standard of living.

In the future, he plans to uproot the indigenous banana plantation and plant the more productive tissue culture variety. He says that Juhudi loans are meant for farmers and this is very encouraging because farmers have been neglected for a long time.

Fabian is 49 years old. He is married with 3 children between the ages of 6 and 18. All the children attend school.

loans.use: To upgrade his banana farming

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat has been operating his mixed farm in Nkubu town, Eastern Kenya for the last 7 years. He has employed two people from his community on a temporary basis. His farm produces bananas and milk which he sells to middlemen. He mainly depends on the income from his farming activities to cater for the basic needs of his family.

Josphat has requested this loan of 45,000 Kenyan Shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase pipes for irrigation. He says that this loan will increase the productivity of his farm and this means increased income to help in educating his children. His major challenges have been insufficient water supply and inadequate land to expand his farming.

Josphat is 44 years old. He is married and has 4 children whose ages are between 9 and 18. All the children attend school.

He plans to buy another plot of land in the future to increase his productivity and income. He comments that Juhudi Kilimo staff are friendly and the products are farmer friendly.

loans.use: To purchase pipes for irrigation

loans.name: Asif

texts.en: Asif A. 42, owns a little grocery store in the local market where he sells a variety of goods. Asif and his wife have one daughter to support. His monthly income is 250-350 AZN.  Asif has asked for a loan of 900 AZN to purchase more grocery products to expand his options and increase his inventory.  He believes that this will allow him to reach a wider customer base so he can increase his income to provide for his family.  Asif looks forward to seeing the results of this investment and wishes one day to build another food shop.

loans.use: Increase stock.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary R. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs in a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs to cook and sell in the restaurant. Mary is 32 years old and married. Her husband is a driver. She has one child, who goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her restaurant.

loans.use: To stock more foodstuffs to cook and sell in a restaurant

loans.name: Jamlick

texts.en:
Jamlick has a mixed farm in the town of Nkubu in Eastern Kenya. He has been farming for the last nine years and has employed one farm hand. His farm produces bananas, milk and coffee which he sells at a local market. He also earns income from his wood workshop in the same area.

His biggest challenges in farming have been the unfavourable weather conditions and fluctuating milk prices.

Jamlick recently completed his previous loan of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 60,000 Kenyan Shillings to upgrade his banana farming. The excess income from this loan will help him in educating his children. He says that this loan will also improve his production on the farm and therefore provide him with a stable income.

He is hopeful that in five years time his farm will have expanded since he plans to plant more bananas and even construct a zero grazing shed for the dairy cows. He comments that Juhudi loans have helped to build him as a farmer. He is now able to do commercialized farming whereas before he used to do subsistence farming.

loans.use: To upgrade his banana farming

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 60 years old and is the widowed mother of four children aged between 30 and 20, two of whom attend school. She has a mixed farm that produces maize, beans, bananas, cassava and groundnuts (peanuts) which she sells locally. She also buys and sells cows at the local market.

Monica has requested this Kshs 35,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. With the milk proceeds she will manage to pay school fees for her children and the family will have enough milk for consumption.

In five years time, Monica plans to increase the acreage of her shamba (a field used for growing crops) thus increasing her product output and her income and also buy other dairy cows.

The major challenges Monica faces in business are drought that affects her farming by reduction of the harvest, diseases that affects the crops, and lack of enough finances to capitalize and expand her business. She is, however, grateful to Juhudi for the loan and would like to get another loan after repaying this current one.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Seydina

texts.fr:
Monsieur Seydina S. est un habitant  du quartier de Ndenatte dans  la localité de Yoff. Il est marié et  âgé  de 36 ans.
Depuis le bas âgé monsieur S. aimait aller a la plage pour regarder ses ainés s’activer  dans le secteur du mareyage. Et c’est a partir de la ou est née sa passion envers cette activité de mareyage qu’il exerce depuis plus de 10 ans. 
Monsieur S. est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis juillet 2010. Il a déjà  remboursé un prêt antérieur au sein de l’institution. Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs dans le but de renforcer son fond de roulement et de mieux développer son activité. 
Ce financement lui permettra de diversifier les poissons qu’il commercialise et d’accroitre la quantité  de ses produits. L’augmentation de ses bénéfices  lui permettra d’épargner dans l’objectif d’acquérir une pirogue.
texts.en:
Mr. Seydina S. lives in the neighborhood of Ndenatte, in the town of Yoff. He is a 36-year-old married man. From a young age, Mr. S. enjoyed going to the beach to watch his older siblings work in the fish trade. This is how his passion was born for this activity, which he has been carrying on for over 10 years. Mr. S. has been a member of the credit union of Yoff since July 2010. He has already repaid a loan with the institution. He is now seeking a loan of 200,000 francs to bolster his working capital and further develop his business. This funding will enable him to diversify and increase his stocks. With the boost in profits, he will save to buy a canoe.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Tayyar

texts.en:
Tayyar Q., 54, is married and has four children.  He lives in Imishli city and works with his family in the agricultural industry and at his petrol station business.  Many years ago he decided to cultivate his land to generate more income to support his family. Now he applied for a 800 AZN loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and one calf.  

Tayyar enjoys doing this job and his monthly income is about 300-500 AZN,

With his last loan, Tayyar improved his petrol station, which he already successfully repaid.

loans.use: Purchase seeds, fertilizer and one calf.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.

Loice is 47 years old and is married to a peasant. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to change to another type of business like selling foodstuffs at a restaurant.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en:
Shahin H. is 36 years old, married, and has two children. Thanks to his efforts to get ahead and his positive attitude in the community he is now a well known and appreciated merchant.  Previously Shahin was a farm hand, working in the fields for different people.  Because of his hard work he was able to purchase land and cultivate vegetables such as potatoes, onions, carrots, etc.  His wife sells his harvest at the market and his products have become very popular among buyers. 

Now Shahin requests a loan to better serve his customers and to differentiate himself from the competition.  He will use the loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer.  He only wants to continue growing his business and to improve the quality of life for his family.  His loan request is 1000 AZN.  He is a repeat client for AqroInvest and has a very good client history.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare more doughnuts for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice to cook for sale

loans.name: Fagueye

texts.fr:
Madame Fagueye D. est une femme de 62 ans qui habite dans le quartier de Layenne a yoff. Elle est mariée et mère de 8 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 10 et35 ans. 
Madame D. a fait une formation en couture, ensuite elle s’est orientée vers la teinture depuis 10 ans. Ce qui l’a le plus motivé a faire son choix sur ces activités c’est leur aspect lucratif. 
C’est une ancienne sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff car elle est membre depuis novembre 2002. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300000 frs pour réfectionner la dalle de sa maison qui est en mauvais état. Son souci est d’améliorer  le cadre de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fagueye D. is a 62-year-old woman who lives in the neighborhood of Layenne, in Yoff. She is married and the mother of eight children whose ages range from 10 to 35 years old. Mrs. D. trained as a seamstress, then switched to dying for the past 10 years. She chose these activities primarily because of the earning potential. She is an early member of the credit union of Yoff, having joined in November 2002. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs to repair a damaged slab in her house. Her goal is to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair a slab in her house

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena M. is a 36-year old married woman who supports her family by operating 3 business ventures:   Videoke (Karaoke with video) , a General store and a rice retailer businesses. She lives in Brgy Poblacion, Roxas, Palawan. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her Videoke, General store and rice retailer businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3200. 

Elena is now borrowing PHP 15000 so that she  could  fund and sustain the operations of her Videoke business . This will be her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Elena aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Business funds operation

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria O. is a 52-year old widow who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures:  Vegetable Vending and Videoke  businesses. She lives in Prk. Pag-asa, Brgy 1 Poblacion, Roxas, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her Vegetable Vending and Videoke  businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 20800 each month. Gloria is now borrowing PHP 29500 so that she  could  purchase more vegetables to sell.   This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29500, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Gloria aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the  Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. has received junior high education. She is married and lives together with her three children. Her husband is a driver.

Ama sells provisions on a table at Takoradi and has been in this business for some time now. She is able to manage her house with the help her husband. Her loan will be used to buy more of her goods for sale.

Ama hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a shop.

loans.use: To buy more of her goods for sale

loans.name: Elsavar

texts.en:
Elsavar A. is a 32 years old entrepreneur who runs a plastic fabric business.  He was working in security but his salary was too low to keep his wife and two children in good conditions. 

A year ago he decided to open his own plastic fabric business and within a year he gained a lot of clients and is very profitable.  Elsavar`s monthly income is 200-250 AZN.  He would like to expand and hire a person who can help him because he has plenty of orders every day.  For this purpose Elsavar applied for a 900 AZN loan.

loans.use: Expand his business.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly B. is a 45-year old married woman who supports her family by operating 3 business ventures:   Food Vending , selling ready-made curtains and hollow blocks production. She lives in Prk Mabuhay, Brgy 3 Poblacion, Roxas, Palawan. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her 3 business ventures, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3000. Merly is now borrowing PHP 13000 so that she  could  purchase more ingredients for her food vending business.   This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 13000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Merly aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for food vending

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame W. is married and has two children. She has received senior high education.

Maame sells foodstuffs at Takoradi and uses her earnings to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase more foodstuffs to expand her business.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to save to build a proper shop for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy extra provisions to sell

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita V. is a married woman who lives in Suyac, Brgy. Taba-ao, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by fishing and selling fish.  Her husband Deonesio V., who is 54 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living.  They have 7 children who are 17 to  34 years old. Carmencita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 9 cycle loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Carmencita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 20000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 10th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15000, which she intends to use purchase more fishing nets and repair her existing nets so that she could continue to save up for future and also repair and improve their fishing boat. Carmencita V. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: purchase more fishing nets and repair old ones

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy additional cassettes for sale

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a la Señora Beatriz M. quien reunio a sus vecinas y asi formaron el comité de Mujeres Trabajadoras, todas las integrantes son del barrio San Miguel.
Todas las mujeres son muy trabajadoras y se dedican principalmente a la venta de frutas y verduras en forma ambulante.
Las reuniones se realizan en el domicilio de la Señora Beatriz M., una señora muy alegre, trabajadora, honesta y todas las del grupo tambien todas son mujeres que siguen adelante con sus emprendimientos con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación y están muy agradecidas a la fundacion por haberles dado esta oportunidad única y por hacer posible que ellas puedan mantener a sus respectivas familias. 
La señora Beatriz M. se dedica especificamente a la venta de ropas y los realiza desde un salón que tiene en su domicilio.
Esta actividad la ha ayudado para ayudar económicamente a su familia especialmente con los gastos escolares de sus hijos.
Solicita el prestamo para la compra de ropas para la venta como remeras, camisas, pantalones, sueter y otras prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños.
texts.en:
This Committee was formed thanks to Mrs. Beatriz M. who gathered her neighbors together into the Mujeres Trabajadoras (Working Women) committee. All the members are from San Miguel neighborhood and are hard working women who are, for the most part, itinerant fruit and vegetable merchants. Meetings are held in Mrs. Beatriz M.’s home. She is a very cheerful, hard working and honest woman. All the group members are women who continue forward with their endeavors with much effort and dedication. They are grateful to the Fundación for having provided them this unique opportunity and for making it possible for them to support their respective families. Mrs. Beatriz M. specifically sells clothing in a room she set up in her home. This activity has been of great economic help to her especially in meeting her children’s school expenses. She is asking for funds to buy clothes like: t-shirts, shirts, pants, sweaters and other articles of clothing for women, men and children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy t-shirts, pants, sweatshirts, shirts, sweaters and other articles of clothing.

loans.name: Conception

texts.en:
Conception V. is a 28-year old married woman who supports her family by operating a fishing/fish vending  business.  She lives in Suyac, brgy. Taba-ao, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing/fish vending  business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 20000. Conception is now borrowing PHP 19500 so that she could  buy fishing gear.  This will be her 9th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19500, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Conception aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing gear

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kibyamirizi Tukole, Mubende Group

texts.en:
T. Norah is a hard working and an ever optimistic 55 year old married mother of 6 children, aged between 28 and 12 years. She operates a growing produce business in Kibyamirizi Trading Centre, Mubende, dealing in buying and selling of cereals like maize, beans, millet and more. 
With a business experience of 15 years, Norah has managed to significantly sustain and improve on her family’s welfare status through paying the school fees for her children and general family welfare. To all appearances, her future business prospects look promising with close to 212,000 Ugandan shillings coming in monthly out of her business. She envisions an even greater profit margin as she gets this loan, being in position to buy more stock for the business. This will enable her to expand business, educate her children and also be able to earn more revenue and live a self sustaining life.

loans.use: purchase more stock of food produce for the business

loans.name: Ndiankou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ndiankou N. est un jeune yoffois de 32 ans qui habite à Yoff  Ndenatte. Il est célibataire sans enfant. 
Monsieur N. est un plongeur sous marin depuis 2002.Il a choisi cette activité par passion mais aussi   pour  gagner sa vie.
Il est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis septembre 2009.Il dispose d’une petite pirogue  pour son activité. Le prêt de 250 000 frs qu’il sollicite est destiné à compléter son épargne en vue de se payer un moteur a bord. Par conséquent ce financement pourra participer a rendre son activité plus rentable et productive.
texts.en:
Mr. Ndiankou N. is a 32 year old man from Yoff who lives in Ndenatte. He is unwed and without children. Mr N. has been underwater diver since 2002. He picked this profession for love as well as to earn a living. He has been a member of the Bank of Yoff since 2009. He utilizes a dugout canoe for his work. The requested loan for 250 000 frs is intended for the completion of his canoe by purchasing an engine. Therefore, this investment could make his business more profitable and productive.

Translated from French by Colleen Creegan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of an engine

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is widowed with eight children and all of them are in school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.   She changed her business enterprises from piggery  to poultry farming. Victoria operates a poultry farm at her home in Ndeeba Kigaga Zone. She has been in this poultry business for a few months.  She sells to all categories of people but at wholesale only.  Victoria works seven days a week and plans to use this loan to buy more chicks and chicken feeds.    She has no additional income and depends on this job for a living.  Her business challenges include transportation of bags of feeds and chicken from Owino market to her home in Ndeeba and poultry diseases.   

Victoria is aspires to see her business grow big get enough to buy a plot of land and a delivery van.  She decided to work with MCDT because they were giving out timely loans. She resides in and owns a house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her challenges are her monthly expenses, her school fees and food.

loans.use: To more chicken feed and chicks

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda B. is from the village of Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 40 years old. Imelda is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Imelda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

location.town: Brgy. Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Gwosusa Emwanyi Lwegula, Mubende Group

texts.en: He has subsisted on a produce sales business for more than 30 years. K. Ibrahim is a fledgling agro sales business trend setter whose example is bound to stand out as a benchmark for other people in his home area of Rulembo, Mubende. Many in his home area preoccupy themselves in self destructive activities like drinking alcohol and smoking marijuana, rather than working hard and taking on their family responsibilities. With his hard work ethic, he has managed to take firm business root. In a month, he apparently makes 130,000 Ugandan shillings. With his monthly savings, he has managed to diversify his small business. This has however not come the easy way as he has had to grapple with many adversities such as the unpredictable weather patterns, which for the most part mean he has fewer supplies from farmers. His dream is to build his own agro produce stalls and storage to keep his surplus goods. With the profits he hopes to be in position to cater to his children’s education costs as he looks forward to own a big family house.

loans.use: To purchase of more stock for the business

loans.name: Katente Unity, Mubende Group

texts.en:
Joseph B., the group leader is in the small photo at the top left corner.

Fror 3 years Joseph has overseen his bar business in Musomba, Mubende. He started the bar with his savings after getting advice from friends. In here, he sells soft drinks like sodas, beer, wines and local gins which he does alongside farming. Once his business got on a firm footing, he was  able to make the best out of it. 

In a month, this focused married father of 8 children, gets 400,000 Ugandan shillings as his monthly profit. With this money he has managed to cater to all his children’s education needs and general family welfare. He has come to grips with some inevitable business challenges and has never lost heart. The determination he carries around  means he is full of optimism that the future of his business will be bright. He is requesting a loan to be able to revamp his business with more stock purchases.

loans.use: To restock his business with sodas, beers, wines and local gins

loans.name: Teresa Albertina

texts.es:
Teresa de 49 años, ella vende dulces en la ventana de su casa que readecuo para tener mas ingresos, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil una zona rodeada del estero salado de Guayaquil. 

Ella hacia tortas y bocaditos conociendo a los hijos de sus clientas, comenzó hablándole a los niños de Dios poco a poco fueron yendo a su casa y ella les ofrecía dulces, ahora los niños les compran cada vez que van. Desde ese tiempo readecuo su casa y ubico a lado de su ventana una pequeña dulcería.

Ella esta variando la mercadería que vende por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar  bandejas, vasos y platos. En el futuro quiere tener mejor surtidos sus dulces y ay tener un local. También seguir hablándole de Dios a los niños del sector.
texts.en:
Teresa is 49 years old. She sells sweets from a window in her house, which she adapted to get more income. She lives in on the Perimetral Highway in Guayaquil in an area surrounded by the salt marsh. She makes cakes and snacks. She met her customers’ children, and she started to talk to the children about God. Little by little they went to her house, and she offered them sweets. Now the children buy each time they go there. She adapted her house and located a small business selling sweets next to her window. She is varying the merchandise that she sells. That is why she wants the loan to buy trays, glasses, and plates. In the future she wants to have a better stock of sweets and to have a shop. She will also continue to talk about God to the children in the sector.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Trays, gasses, and plates

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco B. is from the village of Cabisera 5. He is 48 years old. Francisco is married and has two children. To make a living, Francisco owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Francisco has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Francisco joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisco is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Francisco from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
La presidenta de este comite es la señora Jorgelina quien se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Ella viaja hasta los lugares donde puede adquirir los pollos a menos precio que en el mercado y los vende en su comunidad.
Comenta que esta actividad le deja buena ganancia y que seguira trabajando ya que para ella es muy satisfactorio ayudar a su familia.
Solicita nuevamente el prestamo para invertir en su negocio, compra de pollos en gran cantidad.
Se encuentra muy contenta con sus comprañeras del comité ya que todas las integrantes son trabajadoras y  trabajan para salir  adelante con su esfuerzo y  en nombre del grupo  agradece a la Fundacion por ayudarlas y tener cada una su puesto de trabajo  que ayuda a sus familias.
texts.en:
The president of this group is Jorgelina, who sells chicken. She travels to places where she can buy the chickens at lower prices than in the market, and then sells them in her community. She comments that this activity gives her good earnings and that she will continue working since she is very pleased to be able to help her family. She requests a new loan to invest in her business, to buy chickens in bulk. She is very content with her fellow group members since all of the members are hardworking people who are making an effort to get ahead. On behalf of the group she thanks the Fundacion for helping them so that each can have their own job to help their families.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy chicken

loans.name: Violito

texts.en:
Violito H. is from the village of Sta. Isabel Norte. He is 50 years old. Violito is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Violito owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Violito has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Violito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violito is requesting a loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Violito from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.

loans.name: Lisala Plus Group

texts.en:
Lylie Nlemvo, aged 47, is the leader of the Community Bank named “Lisala Plus”, which is composed of 22 members, united in solidarity to receive loans from the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Lylie Nlemvo runs a pharmacy in the eastern surburb of Kinshasa. She started her business in 1987 selling women’s clothing. She had many difficulties in her business life over the nineties due to the economic and political instability in Kinshasa. From 2005, Lylie decided to change the business and opened a pharmacy that she has been running until today. She is a loyal client of MFI HOPE RDC who has already received six different loans and has repaid them properly. She intends to use the next loan to buy more medicines needed by the customers in her area to resell with the aim of increasing her profits. Each week, her business brings in a profit of US$ 120. 

Her ambition is to expand her business by opening other drugstores in different places. Lylie is married and has two children, who are aged 12 and 20 years old. Both go to school.

loans.use: to buy more medicines needed by customers in her area

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

The main source of income for the business comes from selling beverages including soft drinks and beer in the local community. Perlita is just starting this business.

In 2010, Perlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Perlita is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Perlita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Reyna Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “REYNA DEL CARMEN ”; El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac, provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

El socio es él Sr. Américo, el tiene 35 años D. edad, es casado y estudió en un instituto mecánica automotriz;  el socio trabaja en su propio taller que él mismo diseño, a él le gustaría mejorar su local y comprar algunas herramientas nuevas D. trabajo y pintura para autos, él socio acomodo con presupuesto bajo su taller pero le gustaría mejorarlo poco a poco. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en su  taller y comprar  herramientas nuevas y pintura para autos.    

Los otros socios son docentes, artesanos, administradores D. tiendas y zapatería, otra socia es docente D. música y otra venD. chocolates, otro socio es taxista y otro es albañil.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Reyna del Carmen Communal Bank. The Communal Bank is located in the Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. Mr. Américo is the member. He is 35 years old and married. He studied in an auto mechanics institute. He works in his own shop that he designed by himself. He would like to improve his place and buy some new work tools and paint for automobiles. He fixed up his shop on a low budget, but he would like to improve it little by little. The other members are teachers, artisans, or manage stores or shoe shops. Another member is a music teacher, one sells chocolates, one is a taxi driver, and another is a bricklayer. He values and appreciates the loan that has been provided to him, and he promises to make his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in his shop and buy new tools and paint for automobiles

loans.name: Babacar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Babacar D. est un informaticien de 39 ans qui habite à Yoff Ndenatte. Il est marié et père de 3 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 6 et 12 ans. 
Monsieur D. était employé dans une entreprise de la place dans  un département de maintenance. C’est en 2002 qu’il s’est adonné au dépannage de matériel s informatiques. C’est une occupation qu’il a choisi par passion et aussi pour réaliser des bénéfices. Il est sociétaire de la caisse de Yoff depuis décembre 2007. Il sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs dans le but d’acheter des claviers d’ordinateurs pour les besoins de son atelier multiservices  qu’il gère.
A partir de ce financement son vœux est d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.. Il souhaite faire de ce multiservice une grande entreprise  dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
Mr. Babacar D. is a 39-year-old computer specialist who lives in Yoff Ndenatte. He is married and the father of three children, whose are between 6 and 12 years old. He used to be employed in the maintenance department of a local company. In 2002, he devoted all his time to repairing computer equipment. He chose this occupation out of passion and also to make a profit. Mr. D. has been an associate of the Yoff branch since December 2007. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs with the goal of buying computer keyboards to serve the multi-service shop he manages. With this financing, his wish is to improve his family's living conditions. He would like to turn this multi-service into a big enterprise in the future.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: An investment

loans.name: Harrybert

texts.en:

The main source of income for the business comes from providing motorcycle transport services in the local community. Harrybert has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

loans.use: Buying construction materials for an enclosure

loans.name: Geiner De Los Angeles

texts.es: Geiner de los Angeles G. Rubí, tiene la edad de 20 años, está soltero y vive con sus padres. El crédito lo quiere para la siembra de chile dulce, la idea es comprar el techo (el cual se utiliza para proteger el cultivo del sol y la lluvia) y los insumos necesarios para la producción y también para la mano de obra. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Geiner  también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Geiner de los Angeles G. Rubí, age 20, is single and lives with his parents. He wants the loan to plant sweet chilies. The plan is to buy a roof (to protect the crops from sun and rain), buy the supplies needed for production, and to pay for the labor. He wants to give his crops adequate maintenance in order to get a better quality. He wants to do this in order to get the greatest possible income at harvest time. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He is very happy with the services that have been provided. Geiner has worked in agriculture for several years. In the future he hopes to give his family a better quality of life and greater financial stability. He also wants to be able to keep growing as a person and a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plant sweet chilies

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar R. is from the village of Sta. Isabel Norte. He is 53 years old. Cesar is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Cesar owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Cesar has been engaged in his business for over 25 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Cesar joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cesar is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Cesar from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Candelaria  Norma

texts.es:
La señora Candelaria Norma T. vive en la zona Norte de la Ciudad de Cochabamba en el Barrio conocido como Cala Cala. La señora Candelaria estaba casada pero se divorcio hace más o menos  un año, y solo tiene un hijo que es menor de edad. Candelaria vive con sus 2 hermanas con las cuales también trabaja.

Candelaria es Técnico Veterinario y tiene una pequeña granja  de gallinas ponedoras que está ubicada en la zona del Paso de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Se dedica a la venta de huevo y pollo en la ciudad de Cochabamba por casi 8 años. En este tiempo con la ayuda de sus hermanas pudieron hacer crecer considerablemente el tamaño de su granja.

Candelaria solicita el crédito para poder incrementar sus producción con la compra de más gallinas, y de esta manera seguir incrementando sus ingresos y los de su familia. Su próximo objetivo es poder incrementar de tal manera su producción de huevo que pueda vender también a otras ciudades.
texts.en:
Candelaria Norma T. lives in an area north of the city of Cochabamba in the neighborhood known as Cala Cala. Canelaria was married, but she got divorced about a year ago. She only has one child, a minor. Candelaria lives with her two sisters, and they also work. Candelaria is a veterinary technician. She has a small farm of laying hens, which is located in the Paso area of the city of Cochabamba. She has been selling eggs and chicken in the city of Cochabamba for eight years. During this time, with help from her sisters, they were able to make the size of her farm grow considerably. Candelaria is requesting a loan to be able to increase her production by purchasing more hens. That way she will continue increasing her income and that of her family. Her next objective is to be able to increase egg production in such a way that she will be able to sell in other cities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment capital

loans.name: Edith Maria

texts.es:
Edith de 60 años,  ella tiene un salón de belleza en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil una zona caracterizada por su pobreza. 

Tiene 25 años trabajando como estilista en su propio salón de belleza, aprendió en cursos y por la motivación de mantener a su hijo ya que esta separada de su esposo, trabaja todos los días haciendo cortes de cabello, tinturados, manicura, pedicura. 

Ella quiere mejorar su salón de belleza por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, bloques y pinturas. En el futuro quiere mejorar su local para tener empleados a su cargo y ubicar un spa en su salón.
texts.en:
Sixty-year-old Edith has a beauty salon in the front part of her house. She lives in a semi-urban area in the outskirts of Guayaquil, an area characterized by its poverty. She has worked for 25 years as a stylist in her own beauty salon. She learned this work from classes and because she needed to support her son. She is separated from her husband. She works every day cutting and coloring hair and giving manicures and pedicures. To improve her salon, she will use this loan to buy cement, cement blocks, and paint. In the future, she would like to have employees and have a spa in her salon.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cement, cement blocks, and paint

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa P. is from the village of Lanna, Solana, Cagayan. She is 39 years old. Luisa is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Luisa owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling clothes in the local community. Luisa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Luisa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Luisa is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Luisa from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras 2 Group

texts.en:
Gabina is the coordinator of the group Mujeres Luchadoras 2 (Fighting women).  She makes her home in a simple structure with her long term partner and three children. She says her goal is to have her own house.

Gabina is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business.  She has had her business for over 10 years.  She plans to use this loan to buy underwear and some goods for her fried food stand where she sell meats, plantain, chicken, different fried foods make with flour.  Gabina will use the profits to buy some materials to build part of her house, like blocks, wood, cements etc. 

-------------------------------------------
This Esperanza associate began with us because this foundation give better opportunity with the loans than others and more benefits. Her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally, her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: Buy underwear, flour, oil, meats and others

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “MANOS JUNTAS”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Norma;  Ella tiene 38 años de edad,  y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia se dedica al comercio, ella tiene su stand en el molino y vende ropa y cosméticos,  Ella cada cierto tiempo viaja a Lima o Bolivia a comprar productos de belleza, tipo lápices de cejas, delineadores, rímel, ganchitos y ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para  invertir en mercadería y pasajes.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Norma belongs to the communal bank "Manos Juntas." This bank is located in the Huanchac district, which is part of the province and department of Cusco. Norma is 38 years old, married, and has 3 children. She has a retail business where she sells clothing and cosmetics from a stand in the El Molino market. At times she travels to Lima or Bolivia to buy beauty products including eyebrow pencils, eyeliners, mascara, hair clips and clothing. She requests a loan to invest in merchandise and use for travel expenses. Norma appreciates and values the loan, and as such she promises to comply strictly with the established payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in merchandise and travel expenses for her clothing and cosmetics business

loans.name: Kokoe

texts.fr: cette femme est âgée de 45 ans, elle est veuve et a 2 personnes à sa charge. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale. elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 2009 et s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. son stock a connu une baisse, elle souhaite se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 3 cartons de pâte alimentaire, 4 cartons de conserves, 4 bidons d'huile, 2 cartons de savons et divers. sa clientèle se compose de toute personne.
texts.en:
This 45-year-old woman is a widow with two dependants. She makes a living selling general food products. She started this business in 2009 and gets her stocks at the big market in Lomé. In order to replenish her depleted stocks, she is seeking a loan from WAGES to buy 3 boxes of pasta, 4 boxes of canned food, 4 cans of oil, 2 boxes of various soaps and other miscellaneous items. Her customer base includes anyone.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase general food products

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesús Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo gracias a la Señora Olga O., quien tiene 37 años, esta casada hace 15 años con Oscar Gamarra, tienen dos hijos de 12 y 3 años , ellos viven en el Barrio San Blas.
Olga, vende flores en el cementerio Municipal de San Antonio, pues vive muy cerca del mencionado lugar.
La mujer tiene un puesto de venta de Flores como botón de oro, petunias, crisantemos, flor de arañas, margaritas, lirios, claves, y rosas, además de paños para cruz, mantelitos para panteones, etc.
Ella agradece el  crédito, pues es una buena oportunidad para las mujeres de escasos recursoss de mejorar las actividades a que se dedican.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, y solidaria con los vecinos, ayuda como voluntaria en la Capilla que esta muy cerca de su casa, todos la conocen por su espíritu de colaboración con los demás.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de flores.
texts.en:
This group was formed thanks to la Señora Olga O.. She is 37 years old, is married 15 years to Oscar Gamarra, and has two children 12 and 3 years old, respectively. They live in the San Blas neighborhood. Since she lives very close to the municipal cemetary, she sells flowers there. She has a site where she sells flowers such as "botón de oro" (button of gold), petunias, chrysanthemums, spider flowers, daisies, irises, carnations, and roses, in addition to cloths for crosses, altar cloths for memorials, etc. She is grateful for this loan because it is a good opportunity for women with limited resources to invest in their businesses. She is a hard-working woman, united with her neighbors, and volunteering in the chapel that is close to her home. She is known for her spirit of cooperation with everyone. She requests this loan to buy flowers.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flowers

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “MANOS JUNTAS”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria;  Ella tiene33 años de edad  y es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica a la artesanía y a la bisutería, Ella elabora artes, en cerámica y los complementa con sus estudios de bisutería,  ella desea abrir su local de arte.  La socia solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de materiales.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank "Manos Juntas" or "Hands Together". This bank is located in the Huanchac district which is part of the province and department of Cusco. The member's name is Maria. She is 33 years old, a single mother, and has 2 children. She produces artisan crafts and costume jewelry. She makes ceramic crafts and complements these with her costume jewelry. She wants to open her own arts store. She is requesting a loan to buy materials. The member is grateful for and values the loan and she promises to complete her loan payments in the set period of time.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Nuria

texts.es: Nuria R. N., tiene la edad de 39 años, está en unión libre, y vive con la pareja y sus 3  hijos de  22,14 y 10 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de inventario para su negocio de abarrotes. Desea tener un inventario más amplio y variado de productos para ofrecer en su negocio. Tiene varios años de haber empezado con este negocio, y cuenta con muy buenos clientes, por eso ve la necesidad de ofrecer mayor variedad de productos en el negocio, además de aportar mayores ingresos para la economía de su hogar. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy agradecida con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como comerciante.
texts.en:
Nuria is 39 years old and lives with her partner and their 3 children, who are 22, 14, and 10 years old. She wants a loan to buy supplies for her grocery store. She wants to offer a larger and more varied range of products in her store. She started this business some years ago and she has many good customers, and this is what makes her want to offer a better range of products in the store, as well as contributing more income to the household. This is the first time that she has had a loan from FUDECOSUR and she is very grateful for the facilities that they offer. She hopes that in the future she can offer her family a better quality of life and good economic stability. She also wants to keep growing as a person and as a business woman.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grocery store

loans.name: Henry Nilton

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “MANOS JUNTAS”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

El socio es el Sr.  Nilton;  El tiene 42años de edad  y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio se dedica al comercio minorista, el socio tiene un stand en el centro comercial confraternidad, vende juguetes, el viaja a Lima y Juliaca para ver las novedades den juguetes y traer para implementar su stand.  El socio solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de mercadería.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Manos Juntas ("Joined Hands") community bank in the Huanchac district of the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco. His name is Sr. Nilton. He is 42 years old and married with 3 children. He operates a retail business. He has a stand in the main commercial district where he sells toys. He travels to Lima and Juliaca to see what new toys he might buy and brings back any that he thinks he can resell. He is applying for this loan to buy stock for his business. Sr. Nilton is grateful for the loan and he is fully committed to repaying it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “MANOS JUNTAS”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz;  Ella tiene 27 años de edad  y es soltera; La socia se dedica a la elaboración de mermeladas y también alterna sus actividades con la venta de cosméticos por catálogos, ella está ahorrando su dinero para poder hacer una empresa en el futuro y ser su propia jefa.  La socia solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de insumos.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Manos Juntas” (Hands Together) Communal Bank. This bank is situated in the Huanchac district, which belongs to the Cusco province and department. Luz is the member. She is 27 years old and single. She devotes herself to making marmalade. She also sells cosmetics by catalog, and she alternates these activities. She is saving her money to be able to have a company in the future and be her own boss. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies. She is grateful for and values the loan. She promises to be disciplined and make all of her payments on time. .

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “MANOS JUNTAS”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jhon;  El tiene 35 años de edad,  es soltero y  se dedica al comercio minorista, el socio es proveedor de quesos en diferentes  hoteles y restaurantes,  también trabaja prestando servicio de lavandería.  El socio solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de quesos al por mayor.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Manos Juntas (Hands Together) communal bank. This bank is located in Huanchac District, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco. The member's name is Jhon. He is 35 years old, single, and works in retail sales. The member sells cheeses to different hotels and restaurants. He also works offering laundry services. He is asking for the loan to invest in purchasing cheese in bulk. The member is grateful for and appreciates the loan, and he promises to be careful about making his payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Walter

texts.es: Walter E. O., tiene la edad de 40 años, está casado, y  tiene dos hijos de  17 y 10 años de edad, que son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante, además de la mano de obra. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Walter también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Walter E. O. is 40 years old and married. His two children, ages 17 and 10, are his greatest priority. He wants the loan to help on his farm, specifically for the coffee crop. The plan is to buy natural and chemical fertilizers and to pay for the labor. He wants to give his coffee crop adequate maintenance in order to produce better quality. He wants to get the greatest possible income at harvest time. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with the opportunity presented to him. Walter has worked in agriculture for several years. In the future he hopes to gives his family a better quality of life and greater financial stability. He also wants to be able to keep growing as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance on his coffee crop

loans.name: Victor Elias

texts.es:
Víctor de 49 años, el es mecánico y tiene cinco hijos de 22, 19, 15, 13 y 9 años su esposa vende almuerzos para ayudar con los gastos familiares, vive en la Perimetral de Guayaquil. 

El tiene ya años trabajando como mecánico en su propio taller, comenzó cuando lo despidieron de su trabajo y como no encontraba trabajo decidió abrir su propio taller mecánico, ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. El hace toco tipo de reptaciones a carros. 

El quiere comprar con el préstamo herramientas para poder reparar mas vehículos, en el futuro quiere termina de construir su casa y hacer adecuaciones a su taller.
texts.en:
Víctor, 49, is an auto mechanic. He has five children who are 22, 19, 15, 13 and 9 years of age. His wife sells prepared lunches to help meet family expenses. He lives in Guayaquil’s Beltway. He has worked as a mechanic in his own shop for several years. He started when he lost his job and, not finding new employment, decided to open his own auto repair shop. He is open from 8am until 8pm every day. He performs all types of auto repairs. He wants to buy tools with the loan in order to be able to repair more vehicles. In the future he’d like to finish building his house and refurbish his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For tools.

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr: H. amivi est une dame de 35 ans, elle est veuve et a à sa charge son enfant. afin de subvenir à ses propres besoins et aux besoins de son enfant, elle s'est lancée dans le commerce de tubercules d'ignames; Elle fait ce commerce depuis plus de 5 ans déjà. elle s'approvisionne  à Lomé. beaucoup de propriétaire de restaurant togolais s'approvisionne chez elle. elle a connu une baisse de son stock de marchandises. elle voudrait s'approvisionner, elle a déjà obtenu un crédit de WAGES, elle sollicite ce deuxième crédit pour s'acheter  05 tas de tubercules d'ignames.
texts.en:
H. Amivi is thirty-five years old, a widow, and takes care of her child. In order to meet her needs and the needs of her child, she took up the business of selling yam tubers. She has been involved in this business for more than five years. She gets her supplies in Lomé. She supplies many restaurant owners in Togo. She has seen a reduction in her stock of merchandise. She would like to stock up and has already received one loan from WAGES. She is requesting this second loan to buy five loads of yam tubers.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy yam tubers

loans.name: Hilver

texts.es: Hilver Q. M., tiene la edad de 39 años, está en unión libre, y  tiene dos hijos de  6 y 4 años de edad, que son su mayor prioridad. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Hilver también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Hilver Q. M. is thirty-nine years old, lives with his partner, and has two children (ages six and four) who are his greatest priority. He would like a loan for help with with his coffee cultivation on his farm. The idea is to buy manure and fertilizers. He hopes to provide his crops the best maintenance so he can get the highest quality out of them and increase his income when it comes time to harvest. This is his first loan with "Fudecosur" and he is happy with the help offered. Mr. Hilver has worked in farming for several years. He hopes to be able to provide his family with a higher quality of life and better economic standing in the future. He would also like to continue growing as a person and a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Help for coffee cultivation

loans.name: Amigas De Villa Victoria Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal de “Amigas de Villa Victoria” se conformó para ingresar al Centro Focal de Santiago II, este nuevo grupo consta de ocho integrantes, 7 mujeres y 1 varón, a la cabeza la señora Doris  como presidenta.

La  señora Doris refiere que es su primera experiencia en nuestra institución, su hermano fue quien le invitó a formar parte de la asociación.  El negocio que lleva adelante requiere de paciencia y tiempo, pues se trata de una tienda de barrio.  Una gran ventaja es que su tienda está en el mismo domicilio y su hija le ayuda en la venta. El crédito que solicitó tiene como objetivo la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio.  Lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer es la capacitación y el consultorio de salud.

La A.C. “Amigas de Villa Victoria” cuenta con ocho integrantes que también tienen sus propios negocios, entre ellos tenemos: venta de lencería, tejido de mantas, venta de frutas, tejido de mantas y trenzado, venta de carne, costura de mochilas, trabajo con minibús.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Amigas de Villa Victoria” was formed in connection with the Santiago II Regional Office. This new group has eight members, 7 women and 1 man, headed by Doris as president. Doris comments that it this is her first experience with our institution. Her brother was the one who invited her to become part of the association. The business she runs requires patience and time, because it is a neighborhood store. One great advantage is that the store is in her own home, and her daughter helps her with sales. She requested a loan with the objective of buying merchandise to stock her store. What she likes most about Pro Mujer is the training and the health clinic. The “Amigas de Villa Victoria” communal bank has eight members who also have their own businesses. These include lingerie sales, blanket weaving, fruit sales, braiding and blanket weaving, meat sales, backpack making, and minibus service.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying merchandise for a neighborhood store

loans.name: Hayme Iris

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “MANOS JUNTAS”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hayme,  Ella tiene 35 años de edad  y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de madera, ella está construyendo su casa y necesita dinero para comprar algunos materiales que le han faltado.  La socia solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the “Manos Juntas” communal bank. This bank is located in the Huanchac district, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco. The borrower's name is Hayme. She is 35 years old, married and has two children. Her commercial activity is to purchase and sell timber. She is building her house and seeks funding to buy the material she lacks. She is requesting the loan to be invested in the purchase of construction supplies. The borrower appreciates and values the loan, and accordingly she is committed to making her payments in a disciplined manner according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in the purchase of construction supplies

loans.name: Shirley Del Rosario

texts.es: Shirley Del Rosario tiene 31 años, En este caso la señora tiene un negocio de venta de comida para animales como: vacas, cerdos, gallinas y otros. Por lo que esta ubicado en  su casa de habitación y en una comarca, sus clientes son de las comarcas y personas de la ciudad que tienen crianza de animales, con las ganancias del negocio mantiene su hogar y sus estudios universitarios. Por lo que siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una joven emprendedora y luchadora. Ella necesita del financiamiento para comprar suficiente productos y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y al comprar por mayor así obtiene mayores ganancias.  Por lo que siempre está pensando en mejorar su local con el fin de ampliar un poco más su actividad.
texts.en:
Shirley Del Rosario is 31 years old. In her case, she has a business selling animal feed for animals such as: cows, pigs, chickens and others. Her business is located in her home, and coop. Her clients are from the co-op, and people from her city who care for animals. With the earnings from her business, she maintains her household and covers her expenses from university studies. She has always been characterized as a young entrepreneur and rebel. She needs financing to buy enough products to cover her clients' demands and to by wholesale to achieve better earnings. For this reason, she is always thinking about improving her location, with the goal of increasing her business volume.
