Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: loan for working capital

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
Alejandro tiene la edad de 38 años, casado, padre de tres hijos, con un pequeño negocio de venta de carne de res y cerdo, iniciando hace diez años, con dinero que sus familiares prestaron, ha ido  invirtiendo. Con poco. Pues no tiene el capital suficiente para comprar varias reses como cerdo.
Compra una res y un cerdo logrando la matanza, y luego Sus ventas las realiza en frente de su casa, pone una mesa y su pesa, los clientes que vienen pasando y los que ha captado,  gustan de su carne por ser de calidad.
Con este préstamo comprara: una vaca y un cerdo mas logrando así aumentar la producción de venta de carne.
Sus planes es poder mejorar su vivienda ya que aun falta que repellar paredes, pintar, poner piso. A si como poner un puesto pequeño exclusivo para su venta.  Lo que espera lograr a corto plazo.
texts.en:
Alejandro is 38 years old, married and has three children. He has a small business selling beef and pork. He started this business ten years ago with money that his family lent him. He has been investing a little at a time. Since he doesn't have enough capital to buy cattle or pigs, he buys one cow and one pig which he butchers himself. He then sets up a table and a scale in front of his house and sells the meat to customers that pass by and those that he attracts. They like the quality of his meat. With this loan he will buy one more cow and one more pig to increase his meat production and sales. He wants to be able to make improvements to his home since it still needs walls, paint and flooring. He would also like to have a small stand exclusively for his business. He hopes to achieve these things quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase one cow and one pig to increase his production and sales

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: S. koffi est un  homme âgé de 37 ans, il est marié et mère de 4 enfants. l'activité génératrice de revenu qu'il exerce est le commerce des articles de quincaillerie. il fait ce commerce depuis 2006. actuellement la demande sa clientèle est plus élevée que le stock disponible raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES un 3 ème crédit pour l'achat de 6 tuyaux, 10 pioches, 4 chassien boîte, 6 col en boîte, 20 ampoule et divers autres articles de quincaillerie.il a déjà obtenu 2 crédits qu'il a déjà remboursé sans difficulté.
texts.en:
Koffi S. is a 37 years old man, married and father of four children. His source of revenue is his hardware business. He has been in this business since 2006. At the moment his customers' demand is higher than the available stock. For this reason he requests a third loan by WAGES, in order to purchase six tuyau (air water pipes), ten picks, four hunting cans, six collar boxes, twenty bulbs and other goods. He received two previous loans, that he fully paid pack.

Translated from French by Monica Urban, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hardware

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
Víctor de 56 años, es vendedor de leche de soya, vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil). 

El antes era guardia pero por la falta de ingresos tuvo que buscar otra actividad para poder mantener a su familia, opto por aprender hacer leche de soya y vender en los buses todo el día. Poco a poco los ingresos de la soya hicieron que construya su casa de cemento y pudo tener su propia marca en la botella de soya, ahora el esta readecuando un local para tener hay su pequeña microempresa de leche de soya. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar soya y presentar los registros sanitarios para poder abrir el local (en la foto aparece el loca). En el futuro quiere se distribuidor al por mayor y así disfrutar con su familia.
texts.en:
Víctor is 56 years old. He is a soy milk seller and lives in Primavera de Duran (suburban area in the outskirts of Guayaquil where the natural environment is disappearing). He used to be a guard but due to the shortage of income he had to look for another job to support his family. He decided to learn how to make soy milk and sell it on the buses during the day. The income from soy sales has slowly enabled him to build a cement house and even to put his own brand on soy bottles. He is now fitting out some premises to install his small soy milk company there. With the loan he wants to buy soy and acquire the health certificate required to open the premises (in the photograph). In future he would like to be a wholesale distributor and enjoy the returns with his family.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Soy and health certificate.

loans.name: Meissa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Meissa D. est un jeune pêcheur  de 28 ans qui habite a Mbenguene  a Yoff. Il est marié et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 2 et 5 ans. 
Monsieur D. a hérité cette activité de ses parents qui étaient  des anciens pêcheurs. Il fait aussi du plongeon en haute mer. Monsieur D. a une seconde activité qui consiste à louer des bâches, des tentes et des chaises.
Il est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis juin 2008. Il a déjà  remboursé un prêt antérieur. Il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de chaises destinées à la location. 
Ce financement  lui permettra de développer  son activité. Il souhaite aussi  renforcer son épargne pour disposer d’un local pour y exercer son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Meissa D. is a young 28 year-old fisherman who lives in Mbenguene, in Yoff. He is married and the father of 2 children, ages 2 and 5. Mr. Monsieur inherited this business from his parents, who were formerly fishermen. He also does deep sea diving. Mr. D. has a second business that consists of renting tarpaulins, tents and chairs. He has been a member of the Yoff credit union since June, 2008 and has already repaid a previous loan. He is asking for a loan of 500,000 frs with which he plans to buy chairs to rent. This financing will enable him to expand his business. He also wants to increase his savings so that he can get a place to operate his business.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chairs to rent

loans.name: Nancy Yessenia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “MANOS JUNTAS”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy;  Ella tiene 35 años de edad  y es madre casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica a la administración de su tienda abarrotes, ella a implementado un espacio en la misma tienda en el cual a puesto algunos artículos de librería. La socia necesita implementar con mayor mercadería.  La socia solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la tienda abarrotes en el área de librería con mercadería.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the "Manos Juntas" ("Joint Hands") loan group, based in the Huanchac district in the province and department of Cusco. Nancy is 35 years old. She is married with 2 children. She has a grocery store and has fitted out a space in the store as bookshop. She needs to stock up on merchandise. She is requesting the loan to invest in her grocery store, particularly in merchandise for the bookshop area in the store. She is grateful for the loan, which she values very much, and pledges to pay it back in the agreed terms.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in merchandise for the bookshop space in her grocery store.

loans.name: Jaime Antonio

texts.es: Jaime Antonio, es padre de dos hijos uno estudia en primaria y el otro está menor de edad, su negocio es la venta de CD, Videos, también brinda servicio de fotografía y venta de lotería de manera ambulante. Debido a la difícil situación que enfrentamos el tiene que buscar la forma de proporcionar ingresos para su hogar. Junto a su esposa trabajan cada día para mejorar su negocio y el medio de vida de su familia. En este momento está solicitando un segundo financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio como: compra de DC, Videos, Rollos de Películas, para ofrecer a sus clientes productos de buena calidad, con las ganancias que su negocio le brinda, mantiene su hogar y su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime Antonio is the father of 2 children: one of whom is in school and the other is younger. He has a business selling CDs and videos, and he also provides photography services and sells lottery tickets in the streets. Owing to the difficult situation that we face, he has to look for a way to provide income to his household. Along with his wife, they work every day to improve their business and the standard of living of their family. At this time he is requesting a second loan to invest in the business to buy CDs, videos and film so that he can offer his customers good quality products and, with the earnings that the business provides, support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy CDs, videos and film

loans.name: Marisela  Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Marisela tiene 24 años, ella es madre soltera, tiene una niña de 5 años de edad, el papa de su hija trabaja en una zona franca y le ayuda con los gastos de su hija. La señora se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa y cosméticos en general, cabe señalar que ella ya tiene 4 años de haber comenzado su negocio, ella inicio debido a la necesidad que poseía de brindar manutención a su hija pequeña, que en ese tiempo tenía un año de edad. En los últimos días ha tenido un pequeño problema, debido a que su hija se le había estado enfermando mucho, sin embargo gracias a Dios ya ha mejorado bastante. Su sueño es crecer más en su negocio e incrementar el volumen de mercadería ofertada a sus clientes y algún día establecerse en un tramo del mercado. Ella solicita este préstamo con el objetivo de comprar más mercadería para ofertar más y vender más.
texts.en:
Marisela is 24 years old. She is a single mother and has a five year-old daughter. The daughter's father works in a customs-free zone and helps Marisela support their daugther. Marisela buys and sells clothes and general cosmetics. She began her business four years ago out of the necessity of supporting her young daughter who was then one year old. Recently, Marisela has had a small problem since her daughter has been very sick. Nevertheless, thanks to God, her daughter has gotten a lot better. Marisela's dream is to grow her business and increase the volume of merchandise she can offer her customers. One day, she wants to establish her own space in the local market. She is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise so she can offer more and sell more.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying more merchandise

loans.name: Mame Coumba

texts.fr:
Madame Mame Coumba F. est âgée  de 35 ans. Elle habite a Yoff Layenne. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 3 et 6 ans.
Elle a choisi l’activité de commerce dans le but de réaliser des bénéfices et ainsi  satisfaire  ses besoins personnels. Elle s’active depuis 2008  dans l’achat et la vente de chaussures, de parfums, et de produits cosmétiques. 
Madame F. est membre de la caisse de Yoff depuis novembre 2007. Elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de marchandises destinées a renforcer son stock dans sa cantine. 
Elle souhaite avec l’accroissement de ses revenus améliorer  la situation  sociale de sa famille et aussi élargir son magasin.
texts.en:
Madame Mame Couba F. is thirty-five years old. She lives in Yoff Layenne. She is married and the mother of 2 children, ages 3 and 6. She chose business with the goal of earning a profit and being able to meet her personal needs. She has been active in the purchase and sale of shoes, perfumes and cosmetic products since 2008. Madame F. has been a member of the bank of Yoff since November 2007. She is requesting a loan of 150,000 FRS to be used to buy merchandise to reinforce her stock in her shop. She hopes, with the increase in revenue, to improve the social situation of her family and also to increase the size of her store.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Rafael Evaristo

texts.es: El señor Rafael Evaristo, el tiene 36 años de edad es casado y tiene 2 hijos de ocho y doce años cada uno. Su esposa trabaja como maestra en la escuela de la comarca El Aguacate. Rafael se dedica a la venta de recargas electrónicas y tarjetas de telefonía, el trabaja principalmente con la empresa Claro en una ruta establecida por la empresa, con un buen numero de ventas. Sus ventas las realiza principalmente al contado, las personas le llaman y el envió de la recarga, para después pasar recogiendo el efectivo que es entre 2 a 3 días después. El señor se introdujo en este negocio desde hace dos años, el cual empezó debido  a la falta de empleo de su parte. El está solicitando este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de tarjetas telefónicas y recargas, a ser distribuido. Su sueño es llegar a aumentar el mercado de oferta, esto con el propósito de incrementar las ganancias percibidas por el señor y de esta manera apoyar más a su familia económicamente.
texts.en:
Rafael Evaristo is 36 years old. He is married with two children, who are 8 and 12 years old. His wife works as a teacher at a school in the region of El Aguacate. Rafeal sells telephone cards and reloads phones with more call time [most phone plans in Latin America are pay-as-you-go]. He works primarily with the telephone company Claro on a route established by the company. He has good sale numbers. Most of his sales are done in cash. People call him and he reloads time on their phones. About two to three days later, he goes around collecting payment. Rafael began working in this business two years ago as he was then unemployed. Rafael is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of telephone cards, which he will distribute. His dream is to increase his product offerings to increase his profits, which will better allow him to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying telephone cards

loans.name: Rompiendo Obstaculos 1 Group

texts.en:
Alicia is the coordinator of the group Rompiendo Obstaculos 1 (Breaking Barriers). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children. She says that her most difficult challenges is to work hard to give a better life to her family.

Alicia is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business.  She has had her business for more than five years, starting with a loan and some savings.  Alicia plans to use this loan to buy bags of rice, beans, sugar, coffee, pasta, oil, plantains, vegetables, and more.  She will use the profits to save and improve her business.  She is wishing that her children can have a good education. 

------------------------------------------
This Esperanza associate began with us because this program is focus to help people with their business and her  story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally, her group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: Buy supplies to sell.

loans.name: Mille Manuela

texts.es:
Mille de 48 años, vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil), ella tiene unos departamento que los alquila para cubrir con los gastos familiares. 

Para ayudarle al esposo con los gastos familiares ella comenzó a trabajar y ahorrar dinero para construir unos departamento y alquilarlos, poco a poco con ayuda de su esposo pudo tener sus departamento, ahora ella administra los departamento. Esto le ha ayudado a tener tiempo con su familia y asegurar la estabilidad económica de su hija.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento y pinturas para readecuar los departamento, en el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Mille, 48, lives in Primavera de Duran (an area now on the outskirts of the city, whose natural ecology is fast disappearing.) She has some apartments that she rents to cover the household expenses. To help her husband with the household expenses she began to work and save money to build some apartments and rent them. Gradually, with the help of her husband, she was able to have her apartments. Now she manages the apartments. This has helped her to have time with her family and assure the economic stability of her daughter. With the loan she wants to buy cement and paint to recondition the apartments. In the future she wants to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cement and paint

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es: El señor Carlos Arturo tiene 42 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos los cuales son menores de edad. Su actividad económica de un taller de reparación de bicicletas, en la que además vende los repuestos. Por lo que no es la primera experiencia que tiene con financiamientos pues ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable. Hace más de 13 años que se dedica a esta humilde actividad, con ella ha podido ofrecerles a sus hijos estudios, alimentos y vestimenta. Su esposa trabaja como comerciante de ropa y artículos varios, por lo cual también aporta para el sustento del hogar. E4ste financiamiento será destinado para la compra de materia prima como asientos, cadenas, pedales, aceites, llantas entre otras cosas.
texts.en:
Carlos Arturo, 42, is married and has 2 minor children. He has a workshop where he repairs bicycles and also sells spare parts. This is not the first time that he has taken a loan; he has already proven to be a very responsible person. He has been in this humble line of work for more than 13 years, and with it he has been able to educate, clothe and feed his children. His wife works as a merchant selling clothing and various items to help support the household. This loan will be used to buy parts and supplies such as bicycle seats, chains, pedals, oils, and tires, among other items.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy bicycle parts and supplies

loans.name: Maria Martha

texts.es: La señora María Martha tiene 41 años, ella es casada,  y tiene dos hijos de 9 y 13 años respectivamente. Su esposo trabaja actualmente en Costa Rica. Maria se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa nueva y usada, cabe señalarse ella ya tiene veinte años de tener este negocio y también posee una clientela ya establecida en el municipio. La mayoría de sus ventas son al contado, sin embargo también realiza ventas a crédito principalmente encargos. Este negocio nació por la necesidad de incrementar los ingresos familiares, para mejorar económicamente. Ella desea invertir este crédito en la compra de dos pacas de ropa usada, ya que este producto es el que se está vendiendo más en los últimos días. El préstamo mejorara sus ganancias, ya que actualmente posee varios pedidos de pantalones jeans usados, que es lo que compraría con el préstamo. Su sueño es comprar un tramo en el nuevo mercado en el cual pueda vender sus productos.
texts.en:
María Martha, age 41, is married and has two children. They are 9 and 13 years old. Her husband currently works in Costa Rica. María buys and sells new and used clothes. She has had this business for 20 years. She also has an established customer base in the municipality. Most of her sales are for cash. Nevertheless, she also sells on credit, primarily with orders. This business was born from the necessity of increasing the family income to economically improve. She wants to use this loan to buy two bundles of used clothing. Recently, this product is what she has been selling the most. The loan will improve her income because she currently has various orders for used jeans, which she will buy with the loan. Her dream is to buy a stall in the new market where she would be able to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es:
Víctor de 23 años, el tiene un pequeño local donde vende materiales de construcción, vive en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución). 

Por la falta de oportunidades laborables su familia lo ayudo a conseguir materiales de construcción para que tuviera su propio negocio, con esfuerzo y dedicación pudo tener su propia local para vender mas materiales de construcción. Trabaja todo el día con un ayudante. 

Para tener mas materias y venderlos con mas rapidez a su clientela el quiere compra con el préstamo cemento y ladrillos. En el futuro quiere comprar un solar para su negocio.
texts.en:
Víctor, 23, has a small area where he sells building materials and supplies. He lives in Primavera de Duran, a periurban area in ecological decay. Due to the lack of employment opportunities his family helped him get building materials and supplies so that he could have his own business. With much effort and dedication he managed to get his own locale to sell more building materials and supplies. He works all day with a helper. To have more materials and sell them more quickly to his customers, he wants a loan to buy cement and bricks. In the future, he’d like to buy a lot to install his business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cement and bricks.

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer comerciante dedicada al trabajo, desde hace once años logro poner una pulpería, iniciando con pocos productos, y comenzando con dinero propio.
Su esposo trabaja con productos lácteos, y ha sido de mucho apoyo para sobresalir adelante.
No ha sido fácil, ya que hay día que las venta están bajas, y con varios gastos que tiene que hacer.
Su negocio comienza a dar un jiro cuando comienza a trabajar con Afodenic pues con el  financiamiento logra aumentar el inventario de  su negocio. Logrando a si aumentar las ventas. Hoy en día lleva cinco ciclos trabajando,  el cual ha logrado tener un buen comportamiento de pago.

Con este préstamo comprara todo lo que es grano básico: como quintales de arroz, frijoles, maíz, azúcar, bidones de aceite, cajas de jabón. Para poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Y poder sastifacer sus necesidades personales.
texts.en:
Gloria is a female trader devoted to her work. She set up a grocery store eleven years ago, starting with a few products and her own money. Her husband sells dairy products and has been very supportive to help her get ahead. It has not been easy, because sales are low on certain days and she has to face a number of different expenses. Her business took a turn for the best when she started to work with Afodenic, because the funding allowed her to increase the stock of the business, which resulted in increased sales. She has so far completed five cycles and has shown good behaviour when it comes to payments. With the loan she will buy staples such as quintals of rice, beans, corn, sugar, cans of oil and boxes of soap to meet her customers' demands as well as her personal needs.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy staples such as quintals of rice, beans, sugar, corn, cans of oil and boxes of soap to ensure a better stock and improved sales.

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Marcos;  El tiene 47 años de edad,  es viudo y tiene 2 hijos,  se dedica a la mecánica automotriz, el socio tiene un taller de mecánica y mantenimiento de autos, el socio estudio esta profesión desde muy joven y toda su vida se ha dedicado a esto, es un negocio super rentable y le gusta mucho su profesión, el socio desea comprar algunas herramientas para implementar su taller. El socio solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de herramientas para implementar su taller.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Marcos is a member of the “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO” loan group, based in the Santiago district in the province and department of Cusco. Marcos is 47 years old. He is a widower with two children and works as a mechanic. He owns a vehicle repair and maintenance garage. From an early age he studied to become a mechanic and he has been in this line of business all of his life. It´s a very profitable business and he enjoys it very much. He would like to buy some tools for his garage and so is requesting the loan to pay for them. He is thankful for the loan, which he values highly, and pledges to pay it back in the agreed terms.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of tools for his garage.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Pedro;  El tiene 46 años de edad,  es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos,  se dedica al comercio minorista, el socio es distribuidor de yuca al por mayor y menor él trabaja en el mercado central desde el 2001 y provee yucas a sus clientes,  el socio necesita capital para invertir en la compra al por mayor de yucas. El socio solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de yucas.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Patrón De Santiago De Santiago Communal Bank. This bank is in the Santiago district, which belongs to the Cusco province and department. Pedro is the member. He is 46 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has three children. He is a small businessman, and he is a retail and wholesale cassava distributor. He has worked in the central market since 2001, and he provides his customers with cassava. He needs capital in order to buy wholesale cassava. He is requesting the loan to buy cassava. He is grateful for and values the loan. He promises to be disciplined in making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cassava

loans.name: Martha Eugenia

texts.es: La señora Martha Eugenia se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y perfumes para hombres y mujeres, tiene más de dos años de dedicarse a esta actividad. Por lo que siempre está pensando en la forma de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Ella se levanta muy temprano pues tiene que salir a ofrecer sus productos a diferentes lugares. Es madre soltera, tiene una hija de dos años, con sus ganancias mantiene el hogar  y a su mamá que le cuida a su hija, para poder dedicarse al negocio. Con el financiamiento invertirá en la compra de cosméticos y perfumes, para ofrecer a sus clientes y obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Señora Martha Eugenia earns her living by selling men and women’s cosmetics and colognes. She’s been doing this work for more than two years and is constantly thinking about ways to improve her family’s standard of living. Martha gets up very early because she has to leave the house to sell the products at a variety of locations. She is a single mother of a two-year old daughter. The money she earns is used to maintain the household and pay her mother who looks after her daughter so she can go to work. With the loan Martha will buy cosmetics and colognes to sell to her customers and earn more money.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Karim Patricia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

La socia es  la Sra. Karim;  Ella tiene 37 años de edad,  es separada y tiene 2 hijos,  se dedica al comercio minorista, La socia vende trotas y kekes, ella elabora las tortas y los diferentes kekes y los reparte en diferentes zonas al por mayor para luego ir a cobrar  La socia necesita el capital de trabajo para preparar las tortas en los próximos días.  La socia solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de insumos e ingredientes para la preparación de tortas y kekes.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the “Patron de Santiago de Santiago” communal bank. This bank is located in the Santiago district, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco. The borrower’s name is Karim. She is 37 years old, separated and has two children. Her activity is the retail commerce of pastries and various cakes which she distributes in several areas at wholesale prices, to be collected at a later date. The borrower needs working capital to prepare pastries in the coming days. She is requesting a loan she will use to purchase material and ingredients for the preparation of pastries and cakes. The borrower appreciates and values the loan, and accordingly she is committed to making her payments in a disciplined manner according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of material and ingredients to prepare pastries and cakes.

loans.name: Laskmi

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

La socia es  la Sra. Laskmi;  ella tiene 35 años de edad,  es madre  soltera y tiene 2 hijos, ella trabaja en una encuestadora situada en el barrio de Santa Monica, y también hace chompas artesanales ella tiene un pequeño puesto en el mercado artesanal y comparte su tiempo en ambos trabajos. La socia necesita el préstamo para comprar lanas y una maquina de tejer  y prepara su mercadería.  La socia solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de mercadería y una maquina de tejer.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”. this bank is located in the Santiago district, which belongs to the Cuzco province and department. The member is Mrs. Laskmi. She is 35 years old, and a single mother of 2 children. She works for a pollster located in the Santa Monica neighborhood. She also makes artisanal sweaters. She has a small stall in the artisanal market and she divides her time between both jobs. She needs the loan to buy wool and a knitting machine and to prepare her merchandise. This member is asking for the loan to invest in purchasing merchandise and a knitting machine. She is grateful for and values the loan and is committed to being disciplined in making the payments according to the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The member is asking for the loan to invest in purchasing merchandise and a knitting machine.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John wants a loan to pay for labor and purchase manure for his tea plantation so as to realize better output from the plantation. John is a young gentleman aged 25 years and is a married father of one child. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a tea farmer like most people in his locality, where tea farming is nearly the main source of livelihood. He dreams of becoming a model farmer, building his own house, and educating his children.

loans.use: Paying for labor and purchasing manure for his tea plantation

loans.name: Gissell Norvelia

texts.es: La señora Gissell Norvelia, inicio su negocio con su esposo de venta de artículos ferreteros desde hace de 5 años, en los cuales ofrece: repuestos para bicicletas, motos, materiales de construcción y artículos varios. Ella siempre está pendiente de los que sus diferentes clientes le solicitan, es así que los atrae todos los días. Tiene un hijo pequeño a su cargo. Necesita de un financiamiento para la compra de más artículos y poder mejorar las ventas, con las ganancias del negocio mantiene el hogar y la educación de su hijo.
texts.en:
Señora Gissell Norvelia, along with her husband, started her hardware business five years ago. She sells bicycle and scooter spare parts, construction materials, and various other items. She always takes notice of what her customers are asking for, and that’s what attracts them to her store. Gissell has a young son. She needs a loan to buy more products so she can increase sales. With the money she earns she will support the household and pay for her son’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ayde

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

La socia es  la Sra. Ayde;  Ella tiene 28 años de edad,  es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos, se dedica al comercio minorista,  la socia compra y vende yuca, ella compra al por mayor y lo vende en el mercado central en su puesto. La socia necesita capital de trabajo para invertir en su mercadería futura. La socia solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de mercadería para el siguiente mes.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the community bank “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”. This bank is located is located in the Santiago district, which belongs to the province and department of Cuzco. The member is Ayde. She is 28 years old. She is in a common law marriage and has 3 children. She is a retailer who buys and sells yucca. She buys it wholesale and sells it in the central market at her stall. This member needs the working capital to invest in future merchandise. She is asking for the loan to invest in purchasing merchandise for next month. This member is grateful for and values the loan and is committed to being disciplined in making the payments according to the established payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: This member is asking for the loan to invest in purchasing merchandise for next month.

loans.name: Marco

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

El socio es el Sr .Marco;  El tiene 27 años de edad,  es soltero y  se dedica a la compra y venta de celulares, el alquila un espacio en el mercado el paraíso y hay vende celulares de segunda mano, también repuestos y accesorios y algunas veces los repara. El necesita el dinero como capital de trabajo. El socio solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de mercadería.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO” communal bank. This bank is located in the Santiago district, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco. His name is Marco, and he is 27 years old. He is single and works buying and selling cell phones. He rents a space in the El Paraíso market, and there he sells secondhand cell phones. He also sells spare parts and accessories, and he sometimes repairs phones. He needs the loan funds as working capital. He is requesting the loan to buy merchandise. The borrower appreciates and values the loan, and accordingly, he is committed to making his payments in a disciplined manner according to the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio D. 30 años, vive en Primavera D. Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución), el tiene un pequeño Cyber-cabinas. 

El trabajaba dando mantenimiento a computadoras pero no le alcanzaba para mantener a su familia, por eso comenzó a comprar computadoras para tener un Cyber poco a poco comenzó a comprar impresoras y cabinas D. teléfono. Trabaja todo el día. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar  computadoras para darle una mejor atención a su clienteL., en el futuro quiere tener una línea D. Cyber y así asegurar L. economía D. su familia.
texts.en:
30-year old Julio lives in the suburb of Primavera D. Duran, an area with a deteriorating eco-system. He runs a small Internet cafe. He used to work in computer maintenance but he didn’t earn enough money to support his family, so he started to buy computers so he could open an Internet cafe. Over time he also bought printers and phone booths. He works every day. With the loan Julio wants to buy more computers so he can proviD. a better service to his customers. His goal is to have a chain of cybercafes and thus ensure his family’s financial future.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy computers

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

La socia es  la Sra. Nelida;  Ella tiene 53 años de edad,  es separado y tiene 4 hijos;  se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia compra y vende ropa,  también vende cobertores de camas, sabanas y trae algunos pedidos especiales. La socia necesita el préstamo para comprar mercadería. La socia solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de mercadería.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO” communal bank. This bank is located in the Santiago district, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco. Her name is Nelida, and she is 53 years old. She is separated and has 4 children. She works in retail trade, buying and selling clothing. She also sells bedspreads and sheets, and she fills some special orders. She needs the loan to buy merchandise. She is requesting the loan to invest in purchasing merchandise. The borrower appreciates and values the loan, and accordingly, she is committed to making her payments in a disciplined manner according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in buying merchandise

loans.name: Rolando Jose

texts.es: El señor Rolando José es divorciado y actualmente tiene una hija menor de edad. El señor se dedica a la carpintería, como la elaboración de artículos de madera  entre lo que sobresalen sillas, roperos, cómodas. El señor inicio con este negocio desde hace 10 años, esto con el propósito de tener su propio negocio, y así poder obtener ganancias para brindar la manutención a su hija, este local está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Sus clientes generalmente llegan al taller a solicitarle la elaboración de los artículos. El señor está solicitando este crédito con el objetivo de invertir en la compra de inventario, ya que actualmente posee bastantes pedidos. Por supuesto, el problema que enfrenta su negocio es que a veces no tiene dinero para invertir en el mismo,  por lo que este préstamo le ayudara a comprar más material. Su meta por el momento es ampliar más el negocio hacia otros mercados del país y así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rolando José is divorced and has a minor daughter. He is a carpenter. He makes wood items among which chairs, wardrobes and bureaus are the outstanding ones. He started his business 10 years ago wanting to have his own business to earn income for his daughter’s support. The shop is located in his home. His customers usually come by the shop to ask him to make some article or other. He is asking for funds to buy new stock inventory because he currently has quite a few standing orders. Of course, the problem he faces is that he sometimes doesn’t have money available to buy supplies so the loan will help him with this. His goal for the moment is to expand his business towards other markets in the country thus obtaining greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy carpentry stock and supplies.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a 47-year-old married man with four children. He has a veterinary drug shop. He lives in a permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. He dreams of educating his children, renovating his firm, buying a car and expanding his business. Like most parents and guardians in Uganda, Christopher cannot raise all the school fees required at the start of the academic term thus need for a loan. He wants school fees loan to pay for his child at university.

loans.use: Paying school fees for his child at univertsity

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
Josefa es una madre de familia de 54 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y al ultimo de sus hijos en el caserío Hualtaco del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona productora de frutas para exportación que pertenece a la provincia de Piura y que se encuentra ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde que era joven. Ella suele dedicarse a la crianza y venta de pavos, cuenta con un grupo de estas aves de corral que cría en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen vivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde vive. Adicionalmente cuanta con una pequeña parcela de cultivo donde tiene instalado mango y limón, este último es cosechado semanalmente y luego vendido a las plantas que procesan el fruto para su posterior comercializacion.

Con los ingresos que le brindan estas actividades ella se encarga de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares. Josefa trata de dar lo mejor de si para mantenerse en el negocio y sacar adelante a los que quiere. Actualmente ella desea mejorar la crianza de sus animales realizando mejoras en sus corrales y comprando alimento balanceado, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Con este préstamo Josefa espera obtener mayores ingresos al momento de vender sus animales. Ella es una mujer tranquila, trabajadora y responsable. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y confianza.
texts.en:
Josefa, 54, lives with her husband and her youngest child in Hualtaco settlement in Tambogrande agricultural district, an area that produces fruit for export and is part of Piura province, Piura region, over three hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital. She has been involved in farming-related activities since she was very young. She tends to raise turkeys for subsequent sale. She has a group of these barnyard fowl that she raises in her back yard. When they reach a good level of development she sells them to merchants that visit the area where she lives. She currently has a small piece of farmland where she grows mango and lemon. The lemons are harvested weekly and sold to the processing plants that process the fruit for commercialization. Income from these activities allows her to help her husband meet family expenses. Josefa tries to give her best effort to stay in business and help her loved ones get ahead. She wants to improve her animal-raising by making some improvements to their enclosures and buying nutritionally balanced feed for them. To reach this goal she has deemed it worthy to request a 700 new sol loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa. Josefa hopes that this loan will help her obtain higher income when she sells her animals. She is a tranquil, hard working, responsible woman. Her neighbors and acquaintances trust her and hold her in high esteem.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced turkey feed and to repair their yards.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles, aged 40 years, is a married man with three children, living in a semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He deals in photography and has a videography business, an activity which he has been in for eight years. He wants his children to study and to build a good family standard of living. He wants a loan to buy a black-and-white printing machine.

loans.use: Buying a black-and-white printing machine

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Maria Del Rosario tiene 52 años su estado civil es casada, su esposo trabaja como chofer de un microbús que viaja a León y además posee  3 hijos, los cuales ya son mayores de edad. La señora tiene 30 años de haber comenzado su negocio que es la venta de frutas y verduras, el cual lo inicio en su casa primeramente con la ayuda de su mama, la cual en ese tiempo también vendía frutas y verduras, después con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio pudo establecerse ella sola para vender con capital propio. Actualmente ya tiene 18 años de trabajar sola por lo general trabaja solamente por encargos. Ella solicita este préstamo con el único objetivo de invertirlo en el negocio y poder seguir adelante con el mismo, además que desea obtener mayores ingresos económicos. Su sueño es que Dios le brinde salud para seguir trabajando y de esta manera ganarse el pan de cada día, además de esto desea realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda, si Dios se lo permite.
texts.en:
Maria Del Rosario, 52, is married and has three adult children. Her husband works as a microbus driver on a route to León. She started her fruit and vegetable sales business 30 years ago. She began in her home with help from her mother who at that time was a fruit and vegetable merchant too. Eventually, with much effort and sacrifice, she was able to establish herself on her own to sell her own inventory. To date she has been working independently for 18 years and she usually works based on prior orders only. She is asking for funding to invest in her business to be able to continue with it. She also wants to obtain higher income. Her dream is that God grant her good health to continue to work and thus earn her daily keep. She also wants to make some home improvements, if God permits it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

La socia es  la Sra. Gabriela;  Ella tiene 27 años de edad,  es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo;  se dedica al comercio minorista, La socia vende frutas en el mercado central, ella compra al por mayor del terminal de Quillabamba es una provincia de clima cálido y es llamada la ciudad del eterno verano, aquí existe muchas variedades de frutas ricas y a este paradero llegan muchos vendedores de frutas a comprar de los vendedores directos. La socia solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de mercadería de frutas.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Patron de Santiago de Santiago community bank in the Santiago district of the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco. Her name is Sra. Gabriela. She is 27 years old, partnered and has one son. She operates a retail business, selling fruiits in the central market. She buys wholesale supplies of fruits in the market at Quillabamba, famous for its warm climate and known as the city of eternal summer. Many fruit-sellers go to the market because of the large variety of delicious fruits on offer and the many wholesalers who have businesses there. Sra. Gabriela will use the loan to stock her business. Sra. Gabriela is grateful for the loan and she is fully committed to repaying it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Frank Howard

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Frank;  El tiene 21 años de edad,  es soltero y  tiene 1 hijo; se dedica a prestar sus servicios como seguridad en el aeropuerto del Cusco; el socio trabaja desde muy temprano por la mañana, el socio también puso una tienda a de abarrotes junto a su mama para tener un ingreso extra para ayudar a su menor hijo con la mantención, el socio  estudio turismo pero no termino sus estudios en el instituto, el se puso a trabajar para ayudar a su ex pareja, el necesita implementar su tienda abarrotes.  El socio solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de mercadería y de esta manera implementar su tienda.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Patron de Santiago de Santiago community bank in the Santiago district of the Peruvian "departamento" of Cusco. His name is Sr. Frank. He is 21 years old and single with one child. He works, from very early in the morning, as a security guard at the airport in Cusco. He also started a grocery business with his mother to earn money to help support his young son. Sr. Frank studied tourism at a local institute but left there, before finishing, to work so that he could help his former partner. Now he needs to set up his grocery store and he is applying for a loan to buy merchandise for it. Sr. Frank is grateful for the loan and he is fully committed to repaying it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to set up grocery business.

loans.name: Hernestina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

La socia es  la Sra. Hernestina;  Ella tiene 44 años de edad,  es madre soltera  y  tiene 1 hijo, se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia compra al por mayor fruta y vende en el mercado central en la sección de frutas.  Ella también vende verduras pero por medio de su hija.  La socia solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de frutas y verduras de los proveedores.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO” communal bank. This bank is located in the Santiago district, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco. Her name is Hernestina, and she is 44 years old. She is a single mother with 1 child. Her work is in trade, buying and selling fruit wholesale, and also selling it in the fruit section of the central market. She also sells vegetables but through her daughter. She is requesting the loan to invest in buying merchandise. The borrower appreciates and values the loan, and accordingly she is committed to making her payments in a disciplined manner according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in buying merchandise

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: El señor Adolfo tiene  30 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo de cuatro años de edad. El señor se dedica a una pulpería, el posee en su casa de habitación una pulpería llamada San Danielo, tiene 10 años de tenerla la cual en principio le pertenecía a su mama. Don Adolfo ha continuado con este negocio debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos para mantener a su familia, además que es un negocio bastante rentable. El señor solicita este crédito con el propósito de comprar más mercadería, ya que desea generar mayores ingresos. Su sueño es ampliar mas su negocio para generar mayores ganancias y de esta manera, mejorar la casa en que habita.
texts.en:
Adolfo, 30, is married and has a four-year-old son. He has had a grocery store, called San Danielo, in his homefor 10 years; it used to belong to his mother. Adolfo has continued with this business because he needs to generate income to support his family; besides it’s quite a profitable business. He is asking for funding to buy more merchandise because he wants to produce higher income. His dream is to expand his store further to generate still higher profits and be able to make some improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Elias;  El tiene 32 años de edad,  es soltero y  se dedica a prestar servicio de taxi, el socio trabaja para ahorrar y compra su casa, el socio necesita ahora el préstamo para invertir en el mantenimiento de su vehículo.  El socio solicita el préstamo para  invertir en el mantenimiento de su vehículo.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Patron de Santiago". This bank is located in Santiago district which belongs to the province and department of Cusco. The member is Sr. Elias. He is 32 years old, single, and has a taxi service. He works in order to save and buy his house. He needs a loan now so that he can invest in maintaining his vehicle. The member is grateful for and values the loan and promises to complete the repayments in the set time period.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: El socio solicita el préstamo para  invertir en el mantenimiento de su vehículo.

loans.name: Maydee

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

La socia es  la Sra. Maydee;  Ella tiene 18 años de edad,  es soltera  y  se dedica a la atención de su propio restaurante en la calle zarzuela, la socio a continuado con el negocio de su madre ella ahora se dedica a cocinar y a administrar su negocio. Ella necesita el dinero para comprar productos de primera necesidad.  La socia solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO” communal bank. This bank is located in the Santiago district, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco. Her name is Maydee, and she is 18 years old. She is single, and her work is providing service in her own restaurant, on Zarzuela Street. She has taken over the business from her mother, and now she dedicates herself to cooking and to managing her business. She needs the funds to buy basic products. She is requesting the loan to invest in buying basic products. The borrower appreciates and values the loan, and accordingly she is committed to making her payments in a disciplined manner according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in the purchase of basic products

loans.name: David Salomon

texts.es:
Don David es padre de familia de dos hijos, casado y con un pequeño negocio de soldadura que viene realizando desde joven ya que su padre le enseño a trabajar para ganarse el pan de cada día.
Durante varios años trabajo con herramientas prestada, por no tener el dinero con que comprarla lo que abecés se le hacia difícil.
Es por eso nace la iniciativa de hacer  un financiamiento en donde le permitiera poder realizarse mejor a través de la compra de sus herramientas.
Hoy en día tiene su propio soldador, herramientas, para trabajar, lo que esta contento ya que ha sido gracias a los préstamos que ha logrado fortalecer su negocio.
Con esta solicitud comprara materia prima para lograr la elaboración de soldadura.
Sus planes es poder hacer mejoras a su casa, lo cual no ha podido ya que con los trabajos que hace solo ha podido cubrir la alimentación y otros. Pero que espera tener mejores proyecciones para este año próximo.
texts.en:
David is married and the father of two children. He has a small welding business, which he has been operating since he was a young man, because his father taught him to work to earn his daily bread. For several years, he worked with borrowed tools, because he did not have the money to buy them, which sometimes made things difficult for him. For this reason, he came up with the idea to take out a loan which would permit him to advance in his business by purchasing his own tools. Today, he has his own welding machine and other tools to work with, and he is happy that thanks to the loans, he has been able to strengthen his business. With this loan, he will buy supplies to prepare materials for welding. His plans are to carry out improvements to his home, which he has not been able to do, since he has only been able to cover food and other expenses with his work. However, he hopes to have better prospects for the coming year.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying supplies for his welding business, so he can do more work and pay for food and other expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Karla Isabel

texts.es: La señora Karla Isabel tiene 29 años, ella es casada  y tiene un hijo de seis años de edad. Su esposo trabaja como chofer de un microbús La señora Karla tiene un negocio pequeño de librería y además allí vende cosméticos y artículos en general. Ella dio inicio a este negocio desde hace dos años, empezó vendiendo útiles escolares para los niños cuando iniciaban las clases, esto fue para aprovechar que su casa queda ubicada a media cuadra de la escuela, por lo que tiene buen acceso para que los niños compren en la librería, cabe señalar que su mama le heredo este negocio, ya que en principio era ella la que iba a Managua a realizar las compras. Por supuesto, ella espera que al incrementar la oferta de sus productos, también incrementen sus ventas y por sus ganancias, esto debido a que ofrece buenos productos y a precios accesibles. Por lo que este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima. Su sueño, por el momento es construir un local solo para el negocio independiente de su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Karla Isabel is 29 years old, she is married and has one son six years of age. Her husband works as a driver of a minibus. Mrs. Karla has a small bookstore business and also sells cosmetics and other general merchandise. She started this business two years ago by selling school supplies to children when the school term started, taking advantage of the fact that her house is a half a block from the school. She is well situated for the children to buy at her bookstore. Her mother passed this business on to her, in the beginning her mother was the one going to Managua to do the purchasing. By increasing her merchandise, she expects her sales to increase and therefore her income. This is due to her offering good products at accessible prices. This loan is for the purchase of merchandise. Her dream at the moment, is to have a space dedicated only to her business and independent of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma H. T.   es una señora de 24 años de edad la  cual vive con su esposo en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

El negocio de Vilma es la lechería,  y todos los productos derivados de esta. Sus productos son de  muy buena calidad, y este negocio siempre le ha  dado buenos ingresos, pero necesita crecer.
Es por eso que Doña Vilma está solicitando un Crédito de ¢604.000 (seiscientos cuatro mil colones) para la compra de alambre para la cerca, alimento  y semilla de pasto, para reactivar su producción nuevamente y que sus vaquitas tengan lo que necesitan para dar su mejor leche.

Ella es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo,  y está muy feliz porque asegura que este préstamo le permitirá seguir haciendo lo a ella le gusta y generando ingresos a la misma vez.
texts.en:
Vilma H. T. is a 24-year-old who lives with her husband in a community called Santa Fe, located in Los Chiles, in the Alajuela province. This community is known for being a mountainous area that is very close to the northern border of this country. Its main economic activities are stockbreeding and agriculture, particularly staple grains, sugar cane, and oranges.

Vilma is a dairy farmer, selling all types of products that are derived from milk. Her products are high-quality, and her business has always yielded great profits, but she needs to expand. For this reason, Ms. Vilma is requesting a ¢604.000 CRC loan so that she can purchase wire for her fence, and grass seed in order to reactivate production and to provide everything that her cows need in order give their best milk.

She is a member of the Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe company, one of the 100 organizations that have a partnership with EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan, and she is very happy because she is sure that this loan will allow her to keep doing what she likes while at the same time earning a living.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wire and grass seed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

La socia es  la Sra. Nancy;  Ella tiene34 años de edad,  es  separada y tiene 2 hijas,  se dedica al cuidado de su tienda de abarrotes, ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes  y vende también algunos regalitos, de este modo ella surte su mercadería. La socia necesita capital de trabajo para poder incrementar sus ganancias. La socia solicita el préstamo para  invertir en implementar su tienda de abarrotes.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Patron de Santiago de Santiago" communal bank. This communal bank is based in the district of Santiago, in the province and department of Cusco. This borrower is Ms. Nancy. She is 34 years old, separated, and has two daughters. She runs a grocery store where she also sells some small gifts in order to diversify her merchandise. This borrower needs working capital in order to increase her earnings. She is requesting this loan to invest in running her grocery store. Ms. Nancy is grateful for and values this loan and also promises to be disciplined in complying with the repayment terms that have been established.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in running her grocery store

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “PATRON DE SANTIAGO DE SANTIAGO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Demetrio;  El tiene 55 años de edad,  es  padre soltero y tiene 1 hijo;  se dedica al comercio minorista, el socio es proveedor de productos agrícolas, el trae desde la provincia de Juliaca los productos y otros de la ciudad de Lima, el socio trabaja 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el conoce a todos sus clientes y a él lo conocen también y esta vez requiere le préstamo para hacer de este un capital de trabajo. El socio solicita el préstamo para  invertir en la compra de productos agrícolas.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir disciplinadamente con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the Patrón de Santiago de Santiago Communal Bank. This bank is situated in the Santiago district, which belongs to the Cusco province and department. Demetrio is the member. He is 55 years old, single, and has one child. He devotes himself to retail sales; he provides agricultural products. He gets the products from the Juliaca province and from the city of Lima. He has worked in this business for ten years, and it is going very well for him. He knows all of his customers, and they know him as well. He needs a loan this time for working capital. He is requesting the loan to buy agricultural products. He is grateful for and values the loan. He promises to be disciplined in making his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy agricultural products

loans.name: G. S. La Nueva Vida En Cristo Group

texts.es: La señora María R. Hernández tiene 48 años de edad, es casada con tres, hijos los cuales ya dos son mayores de edad y una hija de 13 años. La señora se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, los cuales distribuye en el mercado el mayoreo. Este negocio surgió desde hace 9 años, dio inicio ante la falta de trabajo que aqueja el país, además de la necesidad de un ingreso fijo. Este negocio lo aprendió de su mama. Ella solicita este crédito con el objetivo de poder invertir en el negocio y de esta manera poder salir adelante. Otro integrante de este grupo es don José Santiago el cual tiene 51 años de edad, Su esposa es ama de casa y solamente le ayuda a preparar la mercadería. El señor se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, el tiene un pequeño tramo localizado en el mercado. El último integrante del grupo es don José Luis, es casado y tiene una hija de 5 años de edad. Su esposa se dedica al comercio de frutas, por lo que le ayuda en su negocio. El señor se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras, el cual vende en el mercado. Este negocio ya tiene 5 años de estar funcionando, dio inicio ante la necesidad de mantener a su hija, después vio que era rentable y decidieron establecerse en un local. Por lo que juntos han decido mejorar sus negocios por medio de los financiamientos.
texts.en:
Ms. María R. Hernández is a 48-year-old married mother with three children, two of whom are grown, and one daughter is 13. Ms. R. sells fruits and vegetables at the wholesale market for a living. She started this business 9 years ago because of the high unemployment rate in the country at that time. Furthermore, she needed to have a steady income. She learned this trade from her mother. She is requesting this loan with the goal of investing it in her business so that she can get ahead. Another member of the group is Mr. José Santiago, age 51, whose wife is a homemaker and helps him prepare the merchandise. He also sells fruits and vegetables at his small stand in the market. The last group member is Mr. José Luis, who is married and has a 5-year-old daughter. His wife sells fruits, and he helps her out. He sells fruits and vegetables at the market. He has been in business for 5 years. He launched the business because he needed to support his daughter. He later realized how lucrative it was and decided to establish himself in a business space. They have all decided to improve their businesses via these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es: El señor Marlon Antonio, es casado y tiene una hija de diez años de edad. Su esposa trabaja en una farmacia. El señor se dedica al servicio de taxi. Este negocio ya tiene seis años de estar funcionando, en primera instancia dio inicio ante la necesidad de trabajo, después vio que era rentable el negocio y decidió continuar con el mismo. Don Marlon solicita este crédito con el objetivo de comprar repuestos para el vehículo, no porque este malo, sino porque desea darle mejores condiciones y mas presentación al mismo. El además trata de brindar un buen servicio, para que las personas lo conozcan y si es posible lo elijan cuando desean viajes privados. Su sueño, es comprar otra unidad que sea manejado por otra persona de su familia, con el objetivo de brindar empleo a otro miembro de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Marlon Antonio is married and has a 10-year-old daughter. His wife works at a pharmacy, while he offers taxi services for a living. He has been in business for six years. He started the business because he needed work, but as he saw how lucrative it was, he decided to stick with it. Mr. Marlon is requesting this loan with the goal of purchasing spare parts for his vehicle, not because it is in disrepair, but because he wants to fix it up and make it look better. He tries to offer the best possible service so that he can become well-known and people can choose him for their private transportation needs. His dream is to purchase another vehicle so that he can offer a job to another one of his family members.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: G. S. Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es: La señora Marisol tiene 41 años de edad, es casada con tres hijos de 6, 12 y 16 años de edad respectivamente. Ella se dedica a la venta de huevos y gallinas, además de esto también distribuye ropa y artículos de cosméticos. Este negocio surgió desde hace 8 años y fue con las ganancias ofrecidas que decidió invertir en los demás artículos. Ella está solicitando este crédito con el propósito de invertirlo en la compra de más mercadería, ya que tiene fe en que ganara más al distribuir más su producto.  Otra integrante de este grupo es doña Margarita García la cual tiene 32 años de edad, ella y su esposo y dos hijas de 4 y 13 años respectivamente. Su esposo trabaja en Managua como distribuidor ambulante de periódico. La señora solicito este crédito con el propósito de invertirlo en compras de huevos y gallinas, ya que el vestuario se está vendiendo poco últimamente.
texts.en:
Ms. Marisol is a 41-year-old married mother with three children ages 6, 12, and 16. She sells eggs and chickens for a living. She also distributes clothing and cosmetics. She started this business 8 years ago, and was able to invest the profits in purchasing other products. She is requesting this loan in order to invest it in purchasing more merchandise, as she has faith that the more she distributes her products, the more she will earn. Another member of the group is Ms. Margarita G., who is 32 years of age. She has a husband and two daughters ages 4 and 13. Her husband distributes newspapers on foot in Managua. She is requesting this loan with the aim of investing it in purchasing eggs and chickens, since her apparel sales have not been doing so well lately.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Gabino

texts.es:
El señor Gabino G. tiene ya más de doce años dedicándose a la elaboración y venta de comida. 
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta inmobiliario y mercancía para la elaboración de los alimentos. Es por eso que está solicitando un préstamo, ya que este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión.  
Porque tiene contratos con diferentes compañía para la entrega de platillos y no quiere perder eso clientes.
Planea pagar el crédito  con una parte de las ganancias del negocio ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es la señora Bertha Alicia Míreles esposa del señor Gabino ya que el día de la visita el se encontraba entregando varios pedidos de comida y quien nos atendió fue señora Bertha Alicia.
texts.en:
Gabino G. has been making and selling food for over 12 years. The business needs furniture and merchandise for making food. He is requesting a loan because at this time he does not have the needed money to make the investment. He has contracts with different companies to deliver the dishes, and he does not want to lose his customers. He plans to pay the loan with part of his earnings from the business, which is the family’s only source of income. The person in the photo is Bertha Alicia Míreles, Gabino’s wife. The day of the visit he was delivering food orders, and Bertha Alicia assisted us.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in his food business

loans.name: Cruz Luciano

texts.es:
Don Cruz Luciano es padre de familia de dos hermosos hijos, casado y con su propio negocio una vulcanización que puso hace varios años con ayuda de sus padres. 
Es un trabajo duro ya que se utiliza mucha fuerza, y un poco peligroso, lo que le fortalece es  que es su propio negocio.
Y que ha crecido gracias a su tenacidad y apoyo de la institución, pues ha logrado poner también un puesto de venta de lubricantes aceites, pequeños repuestos, aprovechando su esposa a vender refrescos, gaseosas, repostería y galletas y a si lograr apoyar a que no falte la alimentación a nuestro hijos.
Con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de lubricantes, aceites, repuestos y otros para seguir ofertando al cliente un mejor servicio. Logrando a si poder vender más y obtener mejores beneficios. 
Como objetivo es seguir aumentando su inventario para lograr un mejor equilibrio.
texts.en:
Cruz Luciano is married and has two beautiful children. He has his own business, a tire repair shop that he started several years ago with help from his parents. It is hard work because it takes a lot of strength, and it is a little bit dangerous. It fortifies him because it is his own business. It has grown thanks to his tenacity and help from the institution. He has also managed to set up a place to sell oil and small replacement parts. His wife takes the opportunity to sell snacks, soft drinks, pastries, and cookies. That is the way they help to make sure that their children do not go without food. He will use this loan to buy lubricants, oil, replacement parts, and other things in order to continue offering his customers better service. Then he will be able to sell more and get better benefits. His objective is to continue increasing his inventory in order to achieve better stability.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials like lubricants, oil, replacment parts, and materials to keep working in his tire repair business and achieve greater sales

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
la señora Adriana Z. es una persona muy dedicada a su negocio, su actividad es la venta de abarroteria, tiene varios años de realizar este trabajo.

Adriana es una persona muy responsable de sus actos, depende una persona de ella, de esa manera que tiene que trabajar muy fuerte para sacarlo adelante.
Varias personas comentaron que es bien responsable a sus compromisos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio para tener mayores ganancias las cuales las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Adriana Z. is a very dedicated to her business. She has had a general store for many years. Adriana is a very responsible person. She supports someone else so she needs to work hard to give him a better chance in life. Many people attest how responsible she is. She will use the loan to buy more inventory and diversify her business. That way she will have more income to cover her household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of juices, sodas, corn flour, "churros", tortillas, soap, toilet paper

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mercedes Eugenia

texts.es:
Mercedes de 64 años, vive en el Guasmo de Guayaquil, es viuda con tres hijos, tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa.

Hace 5 años murió su esposo ella se quedo sola con sus tres hijos, tuvo que invertir  sus ahorros en vivieres y readecuar la parte delantera de su casa para tener su pequeña tienda y así mantener a sus hijos. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora ella ha trabajado desde las 08h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días, en ocasiones se enferma y recae por su edad pero sigue trabajando para asegurar su vejez. 

Ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, aceite y papelería para surtir su tienda. En el futuro quiere readecuar su casa para dársela a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a 64-year-old widow who lives in Guasmo de Guayaquil and has three children. She runs a small general store in the front part of her house.

When her husband passed away 5 years ago, she was left to raise her three children on her own, so she had to invest her savings in purchasing provisions and remodeling the front part of her house so that she could set up her general store and support her children. Since then, she has been working from 8am until 9pm every day. On some occasions, she falls ill due to her age, but she continues to work in order to ensure a peaceful old age.

She would like to purchase rice, cooking oil, and stationery with this loan so that she can restock her shop. In the future, she would like to remodel her house so that she can give it to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, cooking oil and stationery

loans.name: G.s. Triunfadores Group

texts.es: El señor Félix Pedro tiene 62 años de edad, es casado, su esposa labora en una panadería, el tiene 4 hijos los cuales todos son mayores de edad y viven aparte. El señor se dedica a la elaboración de pan, cabe señalarse el señor ya tiene 25 años de dedicarse a esta actividad con una clientela bien establecida en el municipio. Este negocio, en principio fue heredado por su mama, quien en ese tiempo también elaboraba este producto y le enseño como hacerlo. Otro integrante de este grupo es don Pablo José el tiene 46 años de edad, Su esposa es ama de casa y sin embargo, también elabora tortillas para venderla en el municipio, por lo que obtiene un ingreso para la familia.
