El señor se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollo, tiene tres años de trabajar en este negocio. Es por eso que juntos se han unido para realizar el financiamiento y así comprar materia prima para su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Félix Pedro is a 62-year-old married man whose wife works at a bakery. He has 4 children who are all grown and live on their own. Mr. C. makes bread for a living. It must be pointed out that he has been making bread for the last 25 years, and he has a solid client-base in the municipality. This business was initially inherited by his mother, who used to bake bread at the time and showed him how to do it. Another member of the group is Mr. Pablo José, who is 46 years old. His wife is a homemaker who, nevertheless, makes tortillas and sells them in the municipality, allowing her to earn a living for her family. Mr. Pablo raises and sells chickens for a living. He has been in business for three years. These two men have joined forces so that they can obtain a loan and purchase more raw materials for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es:
la señora Maria Josefa R. O. es una persona muy trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de comida y a la produccion de granos basicos.
Maria es bien responsable y honrrada, todos los dias se levanta a las cuatro de la madrugada y asi de esta manera poder salir adelante con las dos actividades que desempeña.
Maria vive en un lugar donde la afluencia de personas es bien grande y esto hace que su negocio sea bien visitado.

el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas materiales para preparar las comidas que vende, tambien quiere comprar fertilizante para los granos basicos que tiene sembrados.
texts.en:
Ms. Maria Josefa R. O. is a very hardworking person who sells food and produces staple grains for a living.

Maria is very honest and responsible. She wakes up at 4am every day, this way, she can get ahead with the two activities in which she is involved.

Maria lives in an affluent area, which means that her business is quite frequented.

She will use this loan to purchase more materials to prepare the food that she sells. She also wants to purchase fertilizer for the grains that she cultivates.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beans, lard, cold meats, beverages, meats, and fertilizer

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa de 39 años, ella tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil. 

Ella comenzó con la tienda para poder mantener a sus tres hijos de 14, 12 y 3 años. Compro enlatados, bebidas y los vendió a sus vecino, poco a poco trabajando desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm. Ahora tiene vitrinas y congeladores para sus productos. La cubeta de huevos la vende a $ 1.12, un enlatado a $ 0.90ctv, etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, enlatados para su tienda, en el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio y surtir mas los productos.
texts.en:
Rosa, 39, has a small grocery store in the front part of her house. She lives in a periurban zone along Guayaquil’s Beltway. She started her store in order to support her three children who are 14, 12, and 3 years of age. She bought canned goods and beverages to sell to her neighbors little by little working from 6am until 10pm. Now, she has display cases and freezers for her products. She sells a bucket of eggs for $1.12, a canned good for 90 cents, etc. She wants the loan to buy rice and canned goods for the store. In the future she wants to increase her sales and stock more goods.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For rice and canned goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bicycle repair parts.

loans.name: Pedro Gualberto

texts.es:
El señor Pedro Gualberto P. S., es una persona de 58 años de edad, es divorciado, tiene dos hijos estudiando en la universidad, es técnico en cerrajería y metalmecánica, es una persona muy seria para realizar su trabajo. 

Se dedica a elaborar puertas, verjas, estructuras para tinglados en fierro y hojalata, con gran habilidad, tiene una experiencia de más de 20 años en el rubro, podemos decir que el es muy conocedor del trabajo su trabajo.  Tiene su taller y vivienda en la zona Muyurina de la ciudad de Cochabamba, un lugar muy estratégico para la actividad que realiza.

El Sr. Pedro Gualberto P. S. se apersono a las oficinas de Cidre para solicitar un crédito, que será utilizado para compra de fierro (le faltó capital de operación) que en esta época está un poco caro, es decir que los costos se incrementan, el mismo que utiliza como materia prima para la elaboración de verjas metálicas.
texts.en:
Mr. Pedro Gualberto P. S. is 58 years old, divorced, and has two children studying at the university. He is an expert locksmith and metal worker. He is very serious about his work. He is skilled at making doors, gates, and sheds made of iron and tin. He has 20 years of experience, and it can be said that he is very expert at his work. His workshop and home are in the Muyurina zone in the city of Cochabamba, which is a very strategic location for the type of work he does. Mr. Pedro Gualberto P. S. appeared at CIDRE's office to request a loan, which he will use to buy iron (he lacks operating capital), which is a little expensive these days, or in other words, the price has gone up. He uses iron as a raw material for crafting metal gates.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy iron for making metallic gates

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre muy trabajador, dedicado a su familia, con  cinco hijos desde joven aprendió el oficio de técnico en reparación de todos electrodomésticos, soldadura, así como la venta y compra de vehiculo. Con ahorros logro comprar un vehiculo lo que ha venido circulando, compra y vende y le queda buena ganancia.
Gracias a sus esfuerzos de trabajo en electrodomésticos, y cuando no trabaja en soldadura para lograr comprar su canasta básica, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa ya que esta laborando como domestica.  Y sobre todo el  apoyo de la institución en donde ha  logrado hacer toda su casa de concreto pues todos sus doce ciclos lo ha invertido en mejora a su vivienda.
Con este financiamiento terminara de hacer el porche, poner piso ya que aun es de tierra, a si como mejorar el techado que esta en malas condiciones.
Para el es de mucha alegría cada día mejorar para un bienestar familiar que junto Afodenic se ha hecho posible.
texts.en:
Juan is a very hardworking man who is dedicated to his family of five children. He learned to repair household electrical goods and welding when he was young, and also buys and sells vehicles. With his savings he bought a vehicle that has been circulating. He buys and sells and gets a good profit. He works hard in the electrical repair business, and when not doing that he welds to be able to buy his basic food, and he has the help of his wife who works as a domestic maid. And above all, the support of the loan institution through 12 loan cycles has enabled him to improve his home and build it from concrete. With this loan, he will finish making the porch, put in a proper floor over the current earth floor, and improve the roof, which is in bad condition. For him, it is a pleasure every day to improve his family's well being, which working with Afodenic has made possible.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials in iron, zinc, and flooring to finish building a porch

loans.name: G. S. Fraternidad Group

texts.es: El señor José Antonio tiene 42 años de edad, es soltero y tiene tres hijos de entre 8 y 18 años de edad. El señor se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, los cuales distribuye en el mercado. El señor está solicitando este crédito con el objetivo de invertirlo en la compra de frutas y verduras, para ofrecer más inventario en el mercado, con la esperanza de obtener más ganancias.  Otro integrante del grupo es Doña Sebastiana Del Carmen,  tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos que ya son mayores de edad. Su esposo trabaja como comerciante en el mercado de Managua, en venta de ropa y zapatos. Su actividad es la venta de carne, sea de res, cerdo o pollo, cabe señalarse este negocio está localizado en su casa de habitación.  Otra integrante del grupo es Doña Maribel Del Socorro, tiene 26 años de edad, es madre soltera de tres hijos los cuales son menores de edad. Ella se dedica a la comercialización de frutas y verduras, los cuales distribuye en el mercado Ella empezó este negocio con recursos propios y principalmente con la ayuda de su mama que fue la que le brindo apoyo cuidando a sus hijos. Hoy en día, lo que más le afecta es el alto costo del transporte, tanto para movilizarse ella como para movilizar la mercadería.
texts.en:
José Antonio, 42, is single and has three children between the ages of 8 and 18. He sells fruits and vegetables in the market. He is asking for the loan to buy fruits and vegetables in order to have more inventory available to offer thus increasing profits. Another member of the group is Sebastiana del Carmen, 49. She is married and has three adult children. Her husband is a merchant in Managua’s market; he sells clothing and shoes. She sells meat be it beef, pork or chicken. It’s worth mentioning that her business is located in her home. Another group member is Maribel del Socorro, 26. She is a single mother of three minor children. She is a fruit and vegetable merchant in the market. She started her business with her own capital and with help from her mother who cared for her children. Today, what most affects her is the high transportation costs both to move her and to move her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El Señor Miguel vive en casa familiar como cuidador de un colegio es soltero no tiene mucha familia, y quiere superarse empezar desde cero es por ese motivo que  empezó desde pequeño como constructor con su papa y le gusto ahora, el trabaja solo porque aprendio mucho gracias a su papa , el también se dedica a la venta de rellenos con su tía son como socios y es por eso que saco el crédito para comprar harina por quintales y también para comprar pintura y  rodillos y otros para la construcciones, el  señor se fue agradecido por la oportunidad  con el crédito, .es nuevo con la institución y con el crédito kiva.
texts.en:
Miguel is single and doesn’t have much family. He lives in a hostel and is employed as a watchman at a school. He wants to improve himself starting from zero. This is the reason he started from a very young age to work as a builder with his father and he liked it. Now he works by himself having learned a lot working for his father. He’s also kind of a partner with his aunt in a rellenos (consist of a layer of mashed potates surrounding a mixture of meat and vegetables beef or chicken with onions, peppers, tomato, etc. which is then dipped in a batter and deep fried) business and that’s why he requested the loan to buy flour by the quintal (weight measure equivalent to 46 kilograms). He will also buy paint and paint rollers and other construction supplies. He was grateful for the opportunity with the loan. He is new to the Institution and to Kiva loans.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paint, paint rollers and others at wholesale.

loans.name: Susy

texts.es: La Señora Susy ,es cliente nueva en crédito individual , la cliente vende comida (almuerzo y desayunos) cerca de su domicilio, la Sra. Vive en la casa de sus padres con sus 3 niños el esposo  por razones de trabajo  se encuentra fuera del país el mismo que le envía  siempre dinero para la los gastos de la familia. Ella atiende sola su negocio a veces le ayuda su mamá La Sra. Eugenia, ella tienen tres hijos en edad escolar  ahora  la cliente solicita el préstamo para incremento de capital de su negocio como ser abarrotes, papa, aceite para la elaboracion de sus riquisimos platos por lo que se solicita este financiamiento kiva.
texts.en:
Susy is a new individual loan client. She sells prepared meals (lunches and breakfasts) near her home. She lives in her parents’ house with her three school aged children. Because of work requirements, her husband is abroad but always sends her money for family expenses. She tends to her business alone although her mother, Eugenia, sometimes helps her. She is asking for funds for groceries, potatoes, cooking oil to make her delicious dishes; this is why she’s asking for this Kiva loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy groceries and cooking oil at wholesale.

loans.name: Alia Saturnina

texts.es: Alia Saturnina tiene 44 años, tiene 1 hijo a su cargo. La señora se dedica al negocio de la compra y venta de ropa y a la elaboración de tortillas, las cuales comercializa de forma ambulante, pese a que también las personas que ya la conocen llegan a su casa a comprar sus productos, sus inicios se dan hace 6 años, esto fue producto de la falta de trabajo y necesitaba una fuente de ingresos para mantener a sus hijos, que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mantener. Este crédito será para la compra de  compra de maíz  y ropa para mantener a sus clientes. Su sueño siempre ha sido, que con las utilidades obtenidas del negocio poder obtener su propia tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Alia Saturnina, 44, has a son under her care. She is an itinerant clothing and tortilla merchant although some of her customers who know her come by her house to buy her products. She started 6 years ago due to the lack of employment opportunities and her need to have a source of income to support her children. With much effort she has managed to survive. This loan will be used to buy corn and clothes to keep her customers happy. Her dream has always been to use profits from the business to obtain her own clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and clothing.

loans.name: Rosa Elsy

texts.es: Rosa Elsy de 36 años de edad, Vive junto a su hijo y esposo. Ella posee el negocio de cosméticos y libros, la cual es de mucha ayuda para su familia, ya que se necesario sufragar los gastos del hogar, es por ello que Rosa cuenta con todo el empeño de salir adelante y mejorar la vida de su pequeño hijo. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuente con la capacidad de poder comprar cosméticos y libros los cuales son muy solicitados en el negocio. Ella alberga la esperanza de que este préstamo sea de mucha ayuda para que su negocio y que por medio de este pueda mejorar sus ganancias y de esta manera poder brindarles todo lo necesario a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa Elsy, 36, lives with her son and husband. She has a cosmetics and book business which are of great help to her family since it is necessary to meet household expenses and Rosa has the determination to do all that is necessary to get ahead and improve her young son’s life. She is asking for funds to buy cosmetics and books which are highly sought after in her business. She has the hope that the loan will be of great use to her business and that it will help her increase profits thereby providing everything necessary for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and books.

loans.name: Wenceslao Miguel

texts.es: El Sr. Wenceslao es de profesión arquitecto, tiene una familia de 3 miembros, su esposa se dedica a la venta de productos de temporada, con el prestamo tiene pensado comprar material de construcción por cantidad como: fierro ,cemento, madera, azulejos y una mescladora, sobre todo estos materiales que son  los que más suben de precio en el mercado, ya que se dedica a realizar contratos con obras vendidas, tambien tiene planes de ahorrar para abrir una constructora junto a su hijo que tambien se encuentra estudiando arquitectura y que el este tiempo se encuentra capacitando con su papá, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Wenceslao is an architect by profession. His family has three members. His wife sells seasonal products. He plans to use the loan to buy building materials and supplies like: iron rods, cement, lumber, tile and a cement mixer especially because these items are the ones whose prices increase the most in the marketplace since he enters into contracts with sold projects. He also plans to save in order to open a construction firm with his son who is also studying architecture and is currently training with his father. He is a responsible and hard working person.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: 1 De Marzo Group

texts.es:
El Centro Focal de Cascada  es uno de los doce centros focales que se encuentran en la ciudad de El Alto. Al mismo ha ingresado la asociación comunal de “1 de Marzo”, este grupo consta de ocho socias y está iniciando su segundo ciclo a la cabeza se encuentra la señora Lucy como presidenta.

La  señora Lucy refiere que es su segundo ciclo en nuestra institución.  Su negocio es el macramé, su crédito inicial fue de Bs.500.- y le sirvió para la compra de flecos para las mantas, actualmente está haciendo una solicitud de Bs.300.- con el mismo objetivo. Este trabajo le permite cuidar su hogar, pues lo realiza en su mismo domicilio y la venta es segura, por que sólo trabaja a pedido de sus clientes.  Con respecto a los servicios de Pro Mujer, ella comenta que le gusta el Consultorio de Salud y su capacitación, por el trato del personal.

La base de la A.C. “1 de Marzo” también tienen sus propios negocios, entre ellos tenemos: Tejido de chompas, tejido de mantas, tejido de mantas y gorras, venta de chinelas, artesanía Tejido de Alpaca, trenzado de mantas, venta de mantas.
texts.en:
The Cascada Focal Center is one of the 12 focal centers in the city of El Alto. The “1 de Marzo” communal bank has joined it. This group has 8 members and is starting its 2nd cycle led by group president, Lucy. Lucy tells us that this is her 2nd cycle in our institution. Her business is macramé. Her initial loan was for Bs.500 and she used it to buy fringes for the blankets. She is currently requesting Bs.300 for the same purpose. This work allows her to care for her home because she does it there and the sales are a sure thing because she only works based on prior orders from her customers. With respect to Pro Mujer services, she states that she likes the Health Center and the training because of the personal attention. Other “1 de Marzo” communal bank members have their own businesses. Among them are: sweater knitting, blanket weaving, blanket and cap weaving, slipper sales, handicrafts, Alpaca woolens, blanket braiding, blanket sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fringe.

loans.name: Alexander Antonio

texts.es: Alexander  es un padre de familia de 31 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a su hijo menor. Se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa nueva desde hace mas de 4 años, Alexander desea adquirir inventario para mejorar la calidad de ropa que ofrece, de este modo planea obtener mayores ingresos al momento de venderlos, para realizar su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a un crédito con cual comprara pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos y trajes formales. El es una persona que brinda todo su esfuerzo en las actividades que realiza, de modo que pueda sacar a su familia adelante, el ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Alexander is a 31 year-old father who lives with his wife and their young son. He has had a business buying and selling new clothing for more than 4 years. Alexander wants to acquire inventory to improve the quality of the clothing he offers. In this way he plans to increase his earnings once he sells the clothes. To do this, he has seen the need to request a loan with which he will buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses and formal suites. He is a person who puts maximum effort into his business so that he can provide for his family. He has worked previously with our institution, and has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility in making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Work Capital

loans.name: Angel Brever

texts.es:
Ángel de 46 años, es mecánico de motocicletas y también vende repuestos, vive en una zona  periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil. tiene dos hijos de 19 y 17 años. 

El tenia una tienda de víveres pero como quería el y su esposa tener mas ingresos decidieron vender repuestos de motocicletas. Poco a poco Ángel aprendió a reparar motocicletas y a vender los repuesto, ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 17h00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar una caja de cambio y válvulas para las motocicletas, en el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio y construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Ángel, age 46, is a motorcycle mechanic and also sells spare parts. He lives in a periurban area on the outskirts of Guayaquil. He has two children ages 19 and 17. He used to have a grocery store, but since he and his wife wanted to have more income they decided to sell spare motorcycle parts. Bit by bit Angel learned to repair motorcycles and sell the spare parts. He now works from 8 am to 5 pm every day. With this loan he wants to buy a gearbox and valves for the motorcycles. In the future he wants to expand his business and improve the structure of his home.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: gear box, ball valve

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia S. M. es una señora 41 años de edad quien vive en una pequeña comunidad llamada La Trinchera de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la piña; siendo estas comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales.  

Doña Sonia tiene 5 años de darle el servicio de comida a la escuela de la comunidad, su negocio es una pequeña soda (puesto de comidas típicas). Ella asegura que siempre le ha ido muy bien con el negocio, sin embargo en  este  momento  necesita un préstamo de  ¢300 000 (trescientos  mil colones) para la compra de una olla arrocera, y para la compra de materiales para construir un compartimiento  donde ubicar el cilindro de gas. Medida de seguridad que se está viendo obligada a tomar para continuar con su negocio. 

Sonia es socia  de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico.
texts.en:
Sonia S. M. is a 41 year-old woman who lives in a small community called La Trinchera de Pital, located in the province of Alajuela. Its primary economic activities are cattle raising and agriculture, above all cultivation of pineapples. These products are sold mostly in international markets. For five years, Ms. Sonia has provided food services to the school in her community. Her business is a small "soda" (a stand with typical foods). She assures that her business has always done very well, but nevertheless, she now needs a loan of ¢300,000 (three thousand colones) to purchase a rice cooker and materials to build a compartment to keep her gas cylinder (a safety measure that is becoming necessary to stay in business). Sonia is a member of Trinchera de Pital's "Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito" ("Community Venture of Successful Women"), one of EDESA's 100 solidarity groups in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan and she hopes that with it, she will be able to continue growing on both a personal and economic level.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a rice cooker and construction materials

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es: Mariano de 41 años, trabaja en la venta de comida y golosinas, el inicio este negocio con fondos propios, pues como todo padre responsable busca la forma de generar ingresos para su familia. Por lo que trabaja todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, por lo que siempre están llegando diferentes clientes a buscar diferentes productos él siempre se esmera en ofrecer un buen servicio pues así es que ha tenido una gran cantidad de clientes. Con el préstamo quiere comprar materia prima necesaria para su actividad. En el futuro quiere surtir su negocio y así ofertar una gran variedad.
texts.en:
Mariano, age 41, works in food and candy sales. He started this business with his own funds, and as a responsible father he wants a way to generate income for his family. So, he works every day from 7 am to 8 pm. Different customers are always arriving in search of different products, so he always goes to a lot of trouble to offer a good service; because of this, he has had a lot of customers. With this loan he wants to buy basic materials for his work. In the future he wants to increase his stock and thus offer a greater variety.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es:
Marvin A. N. es un señor de 45  años de edad quien en una pequeña comunidad llamada La Trinchera de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la piña; siendo estas comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales.  
	
Don Marvin es otro de los habitantes de esta comunidad que se han visto beneficiados por el desarrollo agroindustrial de esta zona. El se encarga de la jardinería y la corta de césped, asegura que tiene mucho trabajo y que la gente le gusta como lo hace. Sin embargo el ha tenido que frenar su trabajo ya que su desbrozadora se encuentra en muy mal estado. Es por eso que  necesita un préstamo de ¢300,000 (trescientos mil colones) para comprar una desbrozadora nueva y poder seguir con su trabajo.
 Dice que lo necesita urgente porque en 5 meses piensa casarse  y necesita trabajar para pagar sus gastos.

Marvin es socio de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico.
texts.en:
Marvin A. N. is a 45 year old man who lives in a small community named La Trinchera de Pital, located in the province of Alajuela. The main economic activities of Alajuela are ranching and agriculture- mainly the cultivation of pineapple, which is sold mainly on international markets. Marvin is one of the members of this community who has benefited from the agro-industrial development in this area. He is a gardener and a grass-cutter. He has a lot of business and people like the way he does his work. However, he has had to stop working because his trimmer is in very bad condition. This is why he needs a loan of ¢300,000 (300,000 colones) to purchase a new trimmer and continue with his work. He says that he needs this urgently because he is getting married in 5 months and he needs to work to pay their expenses. Marvin is a member of the Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Exito de la Trinchera de Pital [Communal Enterprise of the Successful Women of La Trinchera de Pital], one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and with it he hopes to continue growing personally and economically.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of a trimmer

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
Álvaro N. M. es un señor de 40 años de edad quien vive con su esposa y sus dos hermanos en una pequeña comunidad llamada La Trinchera de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela; cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la piña; siendo estas comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales.  
	
El desarrollo agroindustrial de esta zona le dado la oportunidad de  tener nuevas fuentes de empleo a sus habitantes. Hoy Don Álvaro se dedica a la jardinería privada de unas de las empresas que operan en la zona.  El necesita un préstamo de ¢400,000 (cuatrocientos mil colones) para comprar una desbrozadora, la cual necesita para continuar con su trabajo, y hacerlo más efectivo.
Su sueño es que en unos años tenga su propia compañía de jardineros.   

Álvaro  es socio de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico.
texts.en:
Álvaro N. M. is a 40 year old man who lives with his wife and two brothers in a small community named La Trinchera de Pital, located in the province of Alajuela. Alajuela's main economic activities are ranching and agriculture-mainly pineapple, which is sold primarily on international markets. The agroindustrial development of this area has provided its residents with opportunities for new sources of income. Today, Alvaro works as a private gardener for one of the companies that work in the area. He needs a loan of ¢400,000 (400,000 colones) to purchase a trimmer, which he needs to continue with his work and to work more effectively. His dream is to have his own gardening company in a few years. Alvaro is a member of the Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Exito de la Trinchera de Pital [Communal Enterprise of the Successful Women of La Trinchera de Pital], one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan and with it he hopes to continue growing personally and economically.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of a trimmer

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria Cristina de 44 años, ella tiene la venta de tortillas y frijoles cocidos en su vivienda. Este negocio lo aprendió por su mama ya que se dedicaba a  esta actividad con el paso del tiempo ella decidió hacerse cargo y mantener a su familia por medio de su negocio. Inicio por la falta de oportunidades ya que no tenia un trabajo estable para poder mantener a sus hijos. Para poder continuar con su negocio ella quiere comprar frijoles, maíz, entre otros productos. En el futuro quiere mejorar la calidad de sus tortillas y mejorar sus ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Cristina, 44, sells tortillas and cooked beans from her home. She learned this business from her mother who also worked at it. In time, she decided to take over and support her family through this work. She started this business because she didn't have a stable job to support her husband and children and there weren't many other opportunities available. To continue with this work she wants to buy beans and corn among other products. In the future she’d like to improve the quality of her tortillas in order to improve her income and quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beans and corn.

loans.name: Irma Arcadia

texts.es:
la señora Irma Z. es una persona muy trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular,  
actividad que la realiza desde hace 8 años, Irma vive en un lugar muy concurrido y de bastante actividad comercial, esto hace que sus ventas sean buenas.
Irma es bien responsable y de buenos principios morales.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener mas surtida su pulperia y de esta manera poder seguir creciendo y generar mejores ingresos y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irma Z. is a very hardworking person who is in the business of selling popular consumer products (groceries and toiletries) for the past eight years. Irma lives in a very busy and crowded location, which is great for commercial activity, and her sales are good. She is a very responsible person with good moral principles. This loan will be used to purchase more merchandise to stock her store, which will in turn help her grow her business and generate more income to help her attain a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de refrescos, agua en botes y bolsas, churros, lacteos, frijoles, harina de maiz, harina de trigo, tortillas, manteca, arroz, azucar, cafe, galletas, jabones, papel higienico, toallas sanitarias, aceite, sal, huevos. - (bottled water, soft drinks, beans, flour, cornmeal, lard, rice, coffee, crackers, oil, salt, eggs, personal toiletries, etc.)

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nelsa Antonieta

texts.es:
Nelsa de 41 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento pero solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico, ella tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de ropa y papelería.  

Comenzó desde joven trabajando con sus padres, cuando creció y tuvo sus hijos, los ingresos que generaba su esposo no alcanzaban por eso decidió invertir sus ahorros en ropa y venderlos a sus conocidos, ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 20h00pm. 

Ella quiere con el préstamo comprar ropa y papelería para surtir mas su negocio, en el futuro quiere darle un buen futuro a sus hijos y surtir mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Nelsa (41 years of age), lives in the Peruvian area of El Paraiso de Guayaquil. Her home is made of concrete and has only basic electric service. She sells clothing and stationery from a small sales post. Her sales experience began when she was young and helped her parents. Then, when she had her own family and children, and her husband's income wasn't enough, she decided to invest their savings in the purchase of clothing so that she could sell them commercially and supplement their income. She now works from 08h00 a.m. until 20h00 p.m. She wants to use this loan to purchase more clothes and stationery to restock her business. Her desire is to provide a good future for her children and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ropa, papeleria (clothing and stationery products)

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es:
la sra Rosibel C. L. es una mujer trabajadora, que se dedica a la venta de comida y golosinas desde hace varios años en su casa de habitacion.
Rosibel es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales los tiene estudiando en el colegio de la localidad.
Rosibel se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para preparar la comida que vende durante todo el dia.
junto con su esposo han dedicado tiempo para sus hijos.
su tiempo libre lo dedica  a la crianza de gallinas.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas materiales para la fabricacion de las comidas y de las golosinas, para incrementar sus ventas y asi tener mejores utilidades.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosibel C. L. is a hardworking woman, who has been selling food and snacks from her home for the past several years. Rosibel is the mother of three children who are all attending school in town. She awakens at 4 a.m. each day to prepare food to be sold throughout the day. She and her husband are dedicated to their children. Rosibel spends her free time raising chickens. This loan will be used to buy more materials (products) to be used for the manufacture of foods and sweets, in order to increase her sales and bring in better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de refrescos, carnes, tortillas, manteca, arroz, pollo, condimentos, agua, papas, repollos, cebollas, tomates, zanahorias, pepinos, yuca, lechuga. (soft drinks, meats, lard, rice, spices, water, potatoes, onions, tomatoes, carrots, cucumbers, casava and lettuce)

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jackson Luis

texts.es: El Señor Jackson Luis tiene 22 años de edad, él se dedica a una abarrotería en su domicilio, negocio el cual administra por lo que trabaja todos los días desde las 5 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche. Es una persona que ha trabajado toda la vida y gracias a su esfuerzo y constancia puede gozar de una vida tranquila pues siempre está pensando en el bienestar de su familia. Hace más de 2 años que se dedica a este negocio y fue por medio de lucha y sacrificio que ha logrado mantener su negocio. Este financiamiento es para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar aceite y detergente. El sueña con mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mr. Jackson Luis is 22 years of age, and runs a grocery store out of his home every day from 5 am to 7 pm. He has worked his whole life and is thankful that due to his hard work, he can enjoy a tranquil life, but is always concerned with the welfare of his family. The grocery store has been in existence since two years ago and it was through his struggle and sacrifice that he has been able to maintain it. This loan will be used for the purchase of rice, beans, sugar, oil and detergent. He dreams of improving his income.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo (capital for his business)

loans.name: Yaneris Isolina

texts.es:
la joven Yaneris H. es una mujer ejemplar, digna de imitarla pues se dedica al negocio propio, tiene una 
pulperia desde hace pocos años, Yaneris es madre de un bebe de 12 meses, 
junto con su esposo trabajan duro para sacar a su familia adelante y su hogar. 
la joven Yaneris se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para atender a su clientela ya que vive en una zona 
bien productiva.
Yaneris en sus tiempos libres se  dedica  a cuidar a su hija que es lo que mas quiere en este mundo.
texts.en:
Yaneris is an exemplary young woman, worthy of imitation because she has been running her own grocery store for a few years now. Yaneris is the mother of a baby (12 months of age). She and her husband work hard to get ahead and improve their family and home. Yaneris wakes up each day at 5 am to serve her customers in their busy and productive locale. In her free time, Yaneris spends her time caring for her daughter, whom she loves more than anything else in the world.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de pan, cebollas, tomates, repollos, galletas, refrescos, churros, arroz, frijoles, azucar, harina de maiz y trigo, tortillas, lacteos, pastillas, manteca, aceite, jabones, sopas, pastas, chiles, sardinas, refresco en polvo, sal, condimentos (bread, onions, tomatoes, flour, crackers, cornmeal, lard, cooking oil, sugar, soft drinks, soups, pastas, sardines, salt, condiments, soaps, etc.)

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: Juana Francisca tiene 41 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos, los cuales 2 son menores de edad y 2 menores de edad. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra, el cual todos los días sale a trabajar, su negocio inicio hace más de 8 años, por lo que su esposo fue quien inicio esta actividad, y por medio de la buena administración de su negocio es que ha mejorado notablemente. Actualmente desea comprar más productos y vender más. Su desafío es obtener suficiente chatarra y también  es el precio del combustible, que cada día se hace más caro. Este financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima para así comprar más chatarra.
texts.en:
Juana Franisca is 41 year old, married, and has 4 children, 2 of whom are adults and the other two are children. She makes a living by buying and selling fast food. This business was begun more than 8 years ago by her husband, and through good management it has improved substantially. Currently, she wishes to purchase and sell more products. However, her challenge is obtaining the sufficient amount of products and also the cost of fuel, which rises daily. This loan will be used to purchase more fast food.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to purchase more products

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
doña Teresa de Jesus M. es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica  a la venta de productos de limpieza para el hogar tambien vende cosmeticos, gracias a este negocio a podido crecer y educar a sus hijos, los cuales   toda via los tiene estudiando. 
doña Teresa se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para salir a vender su producto en zonas foraneas.
Su tiempo libre lo dedica a su familia y a la cria de cerdos.
el prestamo lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia para incrementar sus ventas y asi tener mas utilidades.
texts.en:
Ms Teresa de Jesus M. is a working woman who sells cleaning products for the home as well as cosmetics. Thanks to her business she has been able to raise and educate her children-all of whom are still studying. Ms Teresa gets up at 5 in the morning to go out and sell her products in distant areas. She spends her free time with her family, and another business for her is to raise pigs. The loan will be used to buy more merchandise to increase her sales and thus have more opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cleaning products for the home and cosmetics

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jose Presley

texts.es:
José de 35 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín, el tiene en la parte delantera de su casa una pequeña tienda. 

Comenzó con la tienda para poder mantener a su familia y ayudar, comenzó hace 2 años vendiendo arroz y bebidas poco a poco pudo surtir mas su tienda y tener unas vitrinas de madera. Vende arroz, bebidas, huevos, lácteos, todo el día desde las 07h30 hasta las 21h00pm. 

Para poder seguir con su negocio quiere comprar con el préstamo bebidas, huevos, lácteos. En el futuro quiere termina de construir su casa y seguir con su negocio.
texts.en:
Jose is 35 years of age, lives in a peri-urban area of el Fortin. For two years now, he's been running a small grocery store in front of his house. This store began out of necessity in order to help his family. He began by selling rice and beverages and then little by little began expanding his products and brought in display cases for his items. He now sells rice, soft drinks, eggs, milk products (every day from 07h30am until 21h00pm). With this loan, he would like to buy additional beverages, eggs and dairy products to restock his business. In the future, he would like to finish building his home and continue with his business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bebidas, huevos, lacteos (beverages, eggs and dairy products)

loans.name: Litara

texts.en:
Litara W. is 49 and married with two children.  She owns a business venture, driving a taxi.  Litara has 5 years of experience in this business.  Litara needs a loan of WST 2400 to maintain her vehicle.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Litara joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Litara's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to maintain vehicle

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La Sra. Rosa O. de 27 años, esta casada con el Sr. Jorge Mendoza de 33 años, tienen la dicha de tener 2 hijos una de 7 años con el nombre de Rocio y otra de 3 años con el nombre de Alma.

Rosa  se dedica a este trabajo hace más de 3 años, aproximadamente desde el año 2007; ella empezó con su esposo que es oficial de crédito  junto su dinero y pusieron el negocio, para poder tener una Ropería, que va creciendo por el ingreso que genera, en la actualidad ya tiene su clientela formada, y su local se encuentra en un lugar estratégico en el mercado de Caaguazú.

Ella utilizaría este crédito en compras de mercaderías para el invierno como camperas, buzos, pantalones, sueter y otros.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa O., 27 years of age, is married to Mr. Jorge Mendoza, 33 years of age. They have the good fortune to have two children: Rocio, 7 years old and Alma, 3 years old. For more than three years (approximately since 2007), Rosa, along with her husband, who is a loan officer, began a clothing business This business is growing and generating income due to its customer base and its strategic location in the Caaguazu Market. Rosa plans to use this loan on purchases of goods for the winter like jackets, sweatshirts, pants, sweaters, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de pantalones, sueter, camperas, buzos y otros. (to purchase pants, sweaters, winter coats, jacket, etc.)

loans.name: Faimasasa

texts.en:
Faimasasa S. is 51 and married with seven children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Faimasasa has 3 years of experience in this business.  Faimasasa needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 320 talas or US $133 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2010, Faimasasa joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Faimasasa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Taape

texts.en:
Taape T. is 48 and married with 3 children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Taape has 3 years of experience in this business.  Taape needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 320 talas or US $133 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2010, Taape joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Taape's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Karoline

texts.en:
Karoline G. is 41 and married with 6 children.  She owns a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish .  Karoline has 4 years of experience in this business.  Karoline needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 210 talas or US $88 per week) to pay her children's tuition fees.

In 2007, Karoline joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Karoline's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Faatamalii

texts.en:
Faatamalii T. is 42 and married with two children.  She owns a business venture, selling lavalavas (bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women).  Faatamalii has one year of experience in this business.  Faatamalii needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 150 talas or US $63 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Faatamalii joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Faatamalii's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Temukisa

texts.en:
Temukisa F. is 27 and married with three children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting 'taamu' (giant taro root) for sale.  Temukisa has three years of experience in this business.  Temukisa needs a loan of WST 1500 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to pay her children's tuition fees.

In 2008, Temukisa joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Temukisa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
La señora Martha Alicia G. tiene tiempo dedicándose a la venta de productos naturales.
Solicita el préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio ya que no cuenta con el capital necesario para la compra de productos, ya que tiene varios pedidos para entregar.
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su negocio ya que su esposo el señor Mauricio Linan se encargara de los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Martha Alicia G. has worked for a long time selling natural products. She is requesting the loan so that she can invest in her business, since she does not have the necessary capital to buy products, and she has several orders to deliver. She plans to pay off the loan with the income she obtains from her business, since her husband, Mauricio Linan, takes care of the family's expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in products for her business

loans.name: Layne Marita

texts.es:
Layne tiene 47 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive junto a su unico hijo en el caserío Tejedores Bajo del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, un área productora de frutas para exportación perteneciente a la provincia de Piura y ubicada en la región del mismo nombre, a mas de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella es maestra de profesión y con mucho esfuerzo pudo ahorrar dinero durante los años que tiene trabajando para adquirir un vehiculo de segunda mano con el cual brinda servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros cubriendo la ruta Tambogrande – Cruceta, el vehículo es manejado por su menor hijo y con los ingresos que perciben de esta actividad ambos mantienen su economía diaria.

Layne desea adquirir un juego de llantas para hacer que su vehículo pueda funcionar de mejor manera ya que debido al constante uso sus llantas actuales se encuentran deterioradas, para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solictar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.

Layne es una madre bastante luchadora y que gusta mucho de la labor que realiza, en la zona donde vive  es bastante conocida y estimada por sus vecinos y amigos.
texts.en:
Layne is 47 years old, a single woman, and lives with her only son in the Tejedores Bajo village in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, an area producing export fruit, within the Piura province. It is located in the the Piura region, more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. She is a teacher by profession and with much effort managed to save money during the years she has been working in order to get a used vehicle which she uses for her cargo and passenger transportation service. Her service covers the route from Tambogrande to Cruceta. The vehicle is driven by her youngest child and with the income that they receive from this business, both are able to support their daily lives. Layne would like to buy a new set of tires so that her vehicle can work better. Due to its constant use, its current tires are in bad condition. In order to do this, she is applying for a loan of 1200 soles for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa. Layne is a hardworking mother who very much likes the work that she does. She is quite well known in the area that she lives in and is respected by her neighbors and friends.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new tires for the maintenance of the vehicle she uses for cargo and passenger transportation.

loans.name: Malia

texts.en:
A 40-year-old married mother of eight, Malia T. has owned a business catching and selling ocean fish for four years. In 2008, Malia joined SPBD and is now requesting her third loan for the amount of WST$1500 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 360 talas or US $150 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family. SPBD's loans are Malia's only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's lending philosophy is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375"

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: La Señora Martha,  tiene 2 hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Tiene como actividad el servicio de pulpería cuenta con 3 años de experiencia en el negocio.  Con el esfuerzo de su esposo fue que empezó pues lo poco que el ganaba lo guardaba  así con el paso del tiempo fueron estableciendo ciertas cosas como detergentes, granos básicos y gaseosas. El crédito será invertido en la compra gaseosas, golosinas, detergentes, productos para el hogar, pan y jugos. Martha Es muy trabajadora, su esposo le ayuda en su actividad le acompaña a realizar las compras de los productos hasta el mercado. Cuenta que su orgullo es proporciónales a sus hijos estudios.
texts.en:
Martha has two young children in her care. She works at a local store and has three years of experience in this business. With the efforts of her husband and saving the little that he made, they slowly began to accumulate various items for the business such as detergents, basic grains, and soft drinks. She will invest this loan in buying soft drinks, sweets, detergents, household products, bread, and juices. Martha is very hardworking and her husband helps her in her business. He goes shopping with her for the store products. She tells us that her greatest source of pride is being able to provide her children with an education.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Nicela Libernesa

texts.es:
Nicela de 58 años, vive en una zona periurbana con lomas y caminos de tierra llamado Paraíso de Guayaquil, ella tiene una pequeña papelería/tienda. 

Comenzó hace años con una copiadora, poco a poco con esfuerzo y después de la muerte de su esposo opto por readecuar su casa y ubicar una papelería en la parte delantera de su casa. Trabaja sola desde muy temprano hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. 

Ella quiere comprar con el préstamo papelería y cuadernos para tener mas ingresos. En el futuro quiere surtir mas su papelería y terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Nicela, 58 years old, lives in Paraíso de Guayaquil, an area in the outskirts of the city with hills and dirt roads. She owns a small stationary store. Many years ago Nicela started out with a copy machine, and little by little with effort and after the death of her husband, she decided to convert the back part of her house into a stationary store. She works by herself starting very early in the morning until 9:00 pm every day. With this loan she would like to buy stationary and notebooks in order to make more income. In the future she would like to supply her store with even more items and finish working on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stationary, notebooks

loans.name: Dorothy Luafa

texts.en:
Dorothy Luafa M., a 22-year-old married mother of two children aged one and five years, owns a business planting and harvesting taro for sale. Dorothy Luafa, who has many years of experience in this business, is now requesting a loan of WST$1000 to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2010, Rosalia joined SPBD, and this is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Dorothy's only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD: In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's lending philosophy is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies & equipment

loans.name: Lalovi Napoleone

texts.en:
Lalovi Napoleone, a 37-year-old married mother of seven children, owns a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale. With two years of experience in this business, Lalovi is now requesting a new loan, her second, of WST $1500 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Lalovi joined SPBD. SPBD's loans are Lalovi's only access to capital because she has never been able able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About SPBD In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's lending philosophy is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15"

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Puna

texts.en:
Puna K. is 36 and married with six children.  She owns a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community.  Puna has three years of experience in this business.  Puna needs a loan of WST 1500 to invest in expanding the business.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to further improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Puna joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Puna's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Palepa

texts.en:
Palepa V. is 34 and married with six children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Palepa has many years of experience in this business.  Palepa needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Palepa joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Palepa's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Eudalia

texts.es:
La señora Eudalia M. tiene ya más de dos años dedicándose ha la venta de ropa usada. Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de ella y su hija quien actual mente esta estudiando. 
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía pero por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión, es por eso que solicita un préstamo y así tendrá más mercancía que vender. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias del negocio.
texts.en:
Eudalia M. has for already more than two years been selling second-hand clothing. This business is the source of income for her and her daughter who is currently studying. Her business needs a greater variety of stock but at the moment she does not have the money needed for this investment. This is why she is asking for a loan so that she will have more stock to sell. She plans to pay the loan from part of the business profits.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stock for the business

loans.name: Reina Marcelina

texts.es:
la sra. Reina Marcelina M. se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de granos básicos como ser maiz y frijoles. 
Su negocio esta  ubicado en la comunidad de El Pescadero del municipio de Danlí, Reina cuenta con varios años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, dichos productos los vende en su casa y en comunidades cercanas.
su mercado potencial lo tiene en EL Paraíso y Danlí.
el negocio lo atiende personalmente y cuenta con una buena clientela lo que le hace ser un negocio rentable.

el credito lo utilizara  para la compra de frijoles de primera ya que se aproxima la temporada de su cosecha y piensa estar preparada para la comercialización de dicho producto ya que muchos de los productores lo venden para la siembras de postrera y necesitan efectivo inmediato tambien comprara maiz.
texts.en:
Ms. Reina Marcelina M. is a saleswoman. Her principal activity is selling basic grains like corn and beans. Her business is located in the community of El Pescadero, in the municipality of Danlí. Reina has several years of experience in this business. She sells the aforementioned products from her house and in the surrounding communities. She has potential markets in El Paraíso and Danlí. She tends her business personally and has a good customer base that makes her business profitable. She will use this loan first to purchase beans, as the harvest season is approaching and she wants to be ready for the sale of the aforementioned products, because many producers sell for the planting season and need cash immediately to buy corn.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy basic grains (beans and corn)

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Pantaleon Remigio

texts.es:
Pantaleon de 52 años, es mecánico de autos y vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil.

Empezó desde pequeño como aprendiz de automóviles, cuando creció para poder mantener a su familia y por la falta de oportunidades el tuvo que trabajar desde como mecánico, ubico el taller en la parte delantera de su casa, pero por las lluvias se vuelve muy lodoso porque su casa esta ubicada en una loma. 
 
Con el préstamo quiere comprar filtros y herramientas para su negocio, en el futuro quiere vender aceites para carros y construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Pantaleon is 52 years old, a mechanic, and lives in a suburban area called Paraiso de Guayaquil. He began as a mechanic apprentice when he was young. When he grew up, he had to work as a mechanic in order to maintain his family and for the lack of opportunities. His workshop is in the front part his house but the rain has caused it to become very muddy, since it is located on a hill. With this loan, he would like to purchase filters and tools for his business. In the future, he wants to sell oil for cars and better construct his house.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Filters and tools.

loans.name: Santos Reymunda

texts.es:
la sra. Santos Raymunda Gómez L. se dedica al comercio, su actividad principal es la elaboracion y venta de nacatamales tambien vende paletas heladas y las distribuye de forma domiciliar, en las fabricas de Tabacos de su sector y en las escuelas.
Dicha actividad tiene mas de 3 años de realizarla, con las ganancias que obtiene de este negocio le ayuda a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

el credito lo esta solicitando ya que necesita invertir en su negocio para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y tener mejores ventas y por ende mejores ganancias las cuales las necesita para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Santos Raymunda G. L. is a business woman. Her primary occupation is the elaboration and the sale of tamales and also the sale of popsicles, which she distributes to homes, factories in Tabacos, and schools. She has been running the following business for more than 3 years. With these earnings, she helps her husband with their household costs. She plans to invest the credit that she is applying for in her business so that she can satisfy her customers' demands and thus improve her sales and earnings, which she needs to be able to give her family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, pork, chicken, vegetables, tamale leaves, condiments, salt, and water.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
La señora Liliana H. y su esposo el señor Sergio Rodriguez tienes dos hijos que desean darles lo mejor. 
La señora Liliana tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa usada y aparatos eléctricos, le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión del negocio.
Es por eso que solicita el préstamo y planea pagarlo con las ganancias que obtendrá del negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Liliana H. and her husband, Mr. Sergio Rodriguez, have two children that they want to be able to provide for. Mrs. Liliana has a small business selling used clothing and electronic devices. She is lacking variety in her merchandise but currently hasn't got the necessary amount of money to invest in her business. For that reason, she is seeking out a loan and plans to pay it back with the profits that she would earn.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in her business

loans.name: Rigoberto Asuncion

texts.es: Rigoberto Asunción 41 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos menores de edad a su cargo. Se dedica al mantenimiento y reparación de computadoras desde hace 15 años, Anteriormente el impartía clases de reparación y mantenimiento fue así que le gusto este trabaja  ya que con estas actividades solventa los gastos económicos de su familia. Rigoberto desea adquirir más  trabajo ya que la mayoría de sus clientes siempre llegan en busca de él.  Como no tiene capital para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar un crédito para la compra de líquidos, herramientas y reguladores de voltaje entre otras cosas. El es un padre trabajador y responsable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive es bastante conocido y estimado por sus vecinos y amigos.
texts.en:
Rigoberto Asunción is 41 years old, married, and has two underage children under his care. For the past 15 years, he has worked in the maintenance and repair of computers. First, he gave repair and maintenance classes and due to them, he found that he liked this job. Also, it proved to help cover his family's economic costs. Rigoberto wishes to acquire more work since the majority of his clients always come looking for him. Since he hasn't got capital to accomplish this, he found it worthwhile to apply for a credit to be able to purchase liquids, tools, and voltage regulators, among other things. He is a hard-working and responsible father. His greatest wish is to continue working in order to be able to give his family a better quality of life. He is quite known and respected by his neighbors and friends in the area where he lives.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Litia

texts.en:
Litia T. is 30 and married with five children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Litia has many years of experience in this business.  Litia needs a loan of WST 1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Litia joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Litia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Lotoi

texts.en:
Lotoi F. is 72 and married with six children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Lotoi has 3 years of experience in this business.  Lotoi needs a loan of WST 1500 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to pay her children's tuition fees.

In 2007, Lotoi joined SPBD.  This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Lotoi's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy K. is 37 and married with five children.  She owns a business venture, selling lavalavas (bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women).  Daisy has 3 years of experience in this business.  Daisy needs a loan of WST 2500 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to pay her children's tuition fees.

In 2007, Daisy joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Daisy's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Kalameli

texts.en:
Kalameli H. is 36 and married with 2 children.  She owns a business venture, selling baked goods in the local community.  Kalameli has 3 years of experience in this business.  Kalameli needs a loan of WST 2000 to buy raw ingredients to make cooked foods.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Kalameli joined SPBD. This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Kalameli's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make cooked foods

loans.name: Elisapeta

texts.en:
Elisapeta I. is 62 and married with six children.  She owns a business venture, selling fabric handicrafts to tourists and local community members.  Elisapeta has 3 years of experience in this business.  Elisapeta needs a loan of WST 1500 to purchase additional handicrafts to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2007, Elisapeta joined SPBD.  This is her 4th loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Elisapeta's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD 

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional handicrafts to sell

loans.name: Rafael Leopoldo

texts.es: Rafael es un padre de familia de 42 años de edad que vive junto a 4 hijos en el. El Se dedica a trabajar en la  compra y venta de ganado por lo que lo heredo de su padre ya que él se dedicaba a tiempo completo a su actividad Con los ingresos que le brindan estas actividades él se encarga de apoyar a su esposa con los gastos familiares. Rafael trata de dar lo mejor de sí para mantenerse en el negocio y sacar adelante a los que quiere. Por lo que quiere obtener muy buenas ganancias por medio de este crédito, que será implementado para la compra de más ganado. El es un hombre muy tranquilo, trabajador y responsable.
texts.en:
Rafael is 42 years old, a father, and lives with his 4 children. He works in the buying and selling of cattle, which he inherited from his father and to which he dedicates himself to full time. With his earnings, he helps his wife with their household costs. Rafael tries to give his all in his work in order to maintain his business and to move those he love forward. With this credit, he hopes to obtain better profits by purchasing more livestock. He is a calm, hard-working, and responsible man.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese U. is 48 and married with six children.  She owns a business venture, selling ice-cakes (flavored ice in styrofoam cups).  Akenese has 3 years of experience in this business.  Akenese needs a loan of WST 2900 to buy sugar, styrofoam cups, and cordial (flavoring).  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2007, Akenese joined SPBD.    This is her 4th loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Akenese's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD

In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD. 

http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to buy sugar, styrofoam cups, and cordial (flavoring)

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Dora pertenece al Banco Comunal Obreras.
Dora es conviviente, tiene 47 años y 4 hijos que estudian, Dora viaja 2 veces por semana a las ferias en donde vende panes, frutas y de las ferias compra cereales que vende en los mercados, además Dora viaja a la selva ayacuchana donde vende frutas de la costa y abarrotes.
Dora necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y pescado.
Dora sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener un negocio estable en su casa.
texts.en:
Dora pertains to the Communal Bank Obreras. Dora is 47 years old, lives with her partner, and has got 4 children that are studying. Dora travels two times a week to fairs where she sells bread and fruit and where she buys cereal that she then sells in the markets. Also, Dora travels to the Ayacuchana jungle where she sells costal fruits and groceries. She needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that she would invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, and fish. She dreams of her children becoming professionals and having a stable business in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, and fish.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna es soltera, tiene 33 años y 1 hijo de 12 años que estudia, Reyna tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende verduras, abarrotes en general, negocio que inicio hace 10 años, actividad que realiza todos los días, además Reyna brinda servicio de bordado de prendas.
